name: 3 Of Our Favorite NYC Board Game Cafes For Some Friendly Or Fierce Competition
description: Whoever came up with the idea of combining board games with cafe culture deserves a medal, if you ask the Secret NYC team. After all, what could be better than sipping a hot drink or tucking into a sweet treat while waging war against your most competitive friends? WithCATAN 6th Editionofficially out in the wild, there’s never been a better time to check out NYC’s board game cafes. Keep reading to discover some of our favorites… As the first board game cafe to settle in NYC, Uncommons paved the way for the thriving tabletop scene – perfect for anyone looking to build their empire, CATAN-style. With 65 seats and one of the largest game libraries on the East Coast, it’s a haven for strategy lovers.

name: Where To Watch The 2025 New York Knicks’ Playoff Run In NYC
description: TheNew York Knicksare making serious noise this postseason, and the energy across the city is off the charts. Whether you’reriding high on Jalen Brunson’s clutch plays or Josh Hart’s hustle, there’s no better time to be a Knicks fan. To help you cheer them on in style,we’ve rounded up some of the top bars in NYC where the New York Knicks playoff vibes are unmatched. Think packed bars, roaring crowds, cold drinks, and screens everywhere you turn. Throw on your orange and blue, rally your crew, and catch all the actionwith fellow diehards around the five boroughs.

name: NYC’s Best May Events — Spring Markets, Dance Parties, Fleet Week, And More
description: Springis in full swing, so we’ve rounded up thebest things to do in May in NYCto keep your calendar well-stacked ahead of the summer. Whether you’re looking to enjoy time outside, soaking up thecherry blossomsin all their glory, or want to head to theGreat White Wayfor a stellar performance, our list of activities has you covered. There’s certainly no shortage of entertainment options. Grab your sunnies and get to ’em! Oh, and friendly reminder: If you’re thinking about leaving NYC — perish the thought!

name: A Hidden Waterfall Oasis Is Tucked Away In Central Park’s North Woods
description: Who knew you didn’t have to escape New York city to see a free flowingwaterfall? ! That’s right, you can save the Upstate New York escape and check out one right herewithin the city itself! Our belovedCentral Park contains a few different kinds of environmentswithin its great expanse, and very few even know about the cascading waterworks. You can stroll through large grassy fields like theGreat Meadow, hike through woodsy trails in theRamble, look over a stunning lake at theJacqueline Kennedy Onassis Reservoir, or even spy amedieval castle!

name: The Stunning Frick Collection Has Finally Reopened — Take A Peek Inside
description: After four years of renovations,the Frick Collectionwill reopen its doors to the public thisApril, inviting guests to experience a world ofGilded Ageopulence — paintings, sculptures, ceramics, and beyond, totaling over 1,800 pieces. This transformation is unlike anything theUpper East Sideinstitution has experienced, and it will usher the space into a new era withnever-before-seen features. Home of industrialistHenry Clay Frick, chairman of theCarnegie Steel Company, the sensational grounds across fromCentral Parkclocks in at 196,000 square feet, 60,000 of which were repurposed and 27,000 of which are courtesy of new construction. Selldorf ArchitectswithBeyer Blinder Belle Architects & Plannerscovered a lot of terrain (quite literally): extending gallery space by 30%, designing the new 220-seat Stephen A. Schwarzman Auditorium, refurbishing reading rooms, and creating a new suite of galleries on the second floor ofthe original Frick family home— territory that is open to the public for the very first time.

name: Pier 17’s Electrifying Summer Rooftop Concert Series Kicks Off This May With Over 60 Shows
description: If you ask us, singing and dancing along to live music in New York City is the perfect way to spend a night. Now, play thatlive musicon top of a rooftop and pair it with warm weather and unparalleled skyline views and, well, that night literally couldn’t get any better. If we’ve piqued your interest you’re in luck–theexhilarating Rooftop at Pier 17 2025 Concert Series is back for the seasonand it’s bringing with it all of the above! A highlight of the momentous South Street Seaport in Downtown Manhattan, the 300,000-square-footPier 17is the port’s signature venue. Eachspringandsummertimethey dedicate their 3,500-capacity, open-air rooftop to an epic concert series, and their2025 season will officially kick off on Thursday, May 1st.

name: Streets Across All Five Boroughs Will Ban Car Traffic For Earth Day
description: Earth Dayis approaching (Tuesday, April 22nd), and with it a time to reflect on what wonders Mother Nature provides and how best we can take care of this beautiful planet. Lucky for New Yorkers, the city has thrown an annualCar-Free Earth Dayevent for the past nine years, and this year will be no different! Earth Day is a global phenomenon kickstarted by activism in the 1960s and 1970s. The first official Earth Day even led to the creation of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). Millions of Americans gathered in protest at the first Earth Day in 1970, and the celebratory day has continuously grown and evolved for climate change advocacy.

name: Lincoln Center’s ‘Summer For The City’ Fest Returns With Over 200 Free And Pay-What-You Wish Performances
description: One of the city’s largest celebrations is gearing up for a grand return — disco ball and all. TheLincoln Center Summer For The City 2025lineup has dropped, and it features over 200 variousfreeandpay-what-you-wishperformances in a variety of disciplines: dance, opera, theater, and beyond, all of which have a global roster of performers. Needless to say, this is a must for yoursummer bucket list. “The live performing arts are fundamental to who we are and to summer in New York City,” saidMariko Silver, President and CEO of Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts. “Nowhere do the rhythms of the world come together like here in New York.

name: The Best Earth Day Events Taking Over NYC This April — Including Free Tree Giveaways, Concerts & More
description: This year forEarth Day in NYC, the city is celebrating sustainability. Throughout the month you’ll find a number of events around the city that encourage New Yorkers to be more environmentally conscious and to live in harmony with our planet! From getting your hands dirty by participating in citywide clean-ups to enjoying free activations on car-free streets (and much more),here are some of the best ways to celebrate Earth Day in NYC this year. The annualCar Free Earth Day in NYCevent will be returning for its seventh year onSaturday, April 26th. 30 blocks of Broadwayin Manhattan will be shut down from vehicular traffic, and New Yorkers can enjoy exciting activations such ashealthy eating demos, an urban design workshop, animal trivia, biofact presentations, and rides on Lime scooters, just to name a few!

name: 9 Incredible Outdoor Art Installations On Display In NYC Right Now
description: This year, New York City has been adding so many wonderfuloutdoor public exhibitionsfor visitors to explore. Our Instagram feeds are certainly in for a treat. Offering an alternative tomuseums,art galleries, andexhibits, these open-air installations are all free to check out and reside in the great outdoors of our city! From sculptures to mind-bending light displays, our curated list of must-see installments is as follows: After a respite in Amsterdam, Scotland, and London, artist John Chamberlain’s work is on its way to 30 Rock: FIDDLERSFORTUNE (Pink) (2010), BALMYWISECRACK (Copper) (2010), and RITZFROLIC (Green) (2008) are large-scale glittery masterpieces that are some of the creator’s final pieces before his death in 2011. Once you’re done admiring the outdoor installation at 30 Rock, venture to Christie’s (20 Rockefeller Plaza) to see smaller but equally dazzling works from the artist, including seven small-scale “Foils,” two “Tonks,” and three tabletop sculptures.

name: Bryant Park’s Free Outdoor Performances Return In May, Including Dance Festivals, Jazz Music, And ‘Carmen’
description: Al fresco season is upon us! TheBryant Park Picnic Performances 2025lineup has just been unveiled, and the completelyfreeseries offers a wide variety of entertainment —guitar festivals,jazz music, acircus festival, and even a showing of the iconic opera,Carmen. Springand summer would be incomplete without this tradition, and we’re looking forward to diving into the complimentary offerings after work. Make sure you bring your picnic blanket! Have a look at the offerings below, and visit theBryant Park websiteto learn more about specifics, including times (most performances kick off at 7pm) and performance summaries.

name: This Long Island Town Is Like Stepping Into The Great Gatsby—And It’s Still Full of 1920s Glamour 100 Years Later
description: F. Scott Fitzgerald’s groundbreaking bookThe Great Gatsbyiscelebrating its 100th birthday this week, and we can’t help but reminisce on NYC’s influence on the classic tale. Particularly right outside inLong Island, the area known as the“North Shore”or the“Gold Coast”served as huge inspiration to the namesakeWest Egg and East Egg neighborhoodsin the book. The coast is well known for itssprawling estates and grand mansions built during the Gilded Age and early 20th century, which became a playground for America’s wealthiest families (like none other than Jay Gatsby). Industrial magnates like theVanderbilts, Guggenheims, and Phippsconstructed opulent homes thatrivaled European palaces over the years, reflecting their immense wealth and influence.

name: Keanu Reeves To Make His Broadway Debut In This Fall’s ‘Waiting For Godot’
description: Broadwayor Hollywood? Waiting For Godotis the latest Great White Way selection to feature an A-list cast, but eager theater-goers will have to wait until the fall to see it. As of thisspring,George Clooney’sGood Night, And Good LuckeclipsedOthelloat the box office, which starsDenzel WashingtonandJake Gyllenhaal. Then you haveNick Jonas, who is breaking hearts inThe Last Five Years. Now, our belovedMatrixstar (and the internet’s favorite fella) is on his way to the stage in the 1953 play fromSamuel Beckett.

name: Pop Into CJ Hendry’s Balloon-Inspired Immersive Exhibition In Brooklyn This April
description: We hate to burst your bubble, but if the new exhibition fromCJ Hendry,“Keff Joons,”isn’t on yourAprilcalendar, you’re doingspringtime in NYCall wrong. The conceptual artist, who has delighted us with afeltflower market,grown-up playground, andinteractive bounce house, is setting up shop inDumbothis spring with what’s sure to be a colorful, fantastical world. While you’re venturing down under the Manhattan Bridge Overpass, pop in to see what the visionary has in store. At this time, Hendry is keeping details mum, but she is teasing fans on Instagram with balloon-themed artwork à laJeff Koons, an icon who is best known for his “Balloon dog” series, and the inspo behind the project’s title. You’ve likely caught images of Hendry’s balloon animal drawings and had to do a double take because they are so realistic.

name: These Cosmic-Inspired Jewels Are Out Of This World — Inside AMNH’s Dazzling New Exhibit
description: For thoseexhibithopping thisspring— and for the celestially in-tune — make sureCosmic Splendor: Jewelry from the Collections of Van Cleef & Arpelsmakes its way onto your list. TheAmerican Museum of Natural Historywill unveil nearly 70 dazzling spectacles on Friday, April 11th, and collection includes the High Jewelry Maison founded in Paris’ Place Vendôme in 1906. Sure the pieces are 119 years old, but trust us, they only get more dazzling with age. Whether you’re interested inastronomyor turn to the sky for answers via astrology, you’ll find a lot to love about these accessories: necklaces that depict rockets in flight, gem-encrusted pendants with inspiration from distant nebulae, and watches that follow planets’ movements. It’s proof that even distant galaxies can have an impact on our fashion and expression.

name: 16 Movies We Can’t Wait To See In 2025
description: Once you start mapping out all of themovies releasing in 2025, you’re liable to wind up with a pretty lengthy list. From remakes to horror newbies, family-friendly animation and the end of a long-standing action franchise,2025‘s lineup is guaranteed to turn anyone into a film buff. Now that you’ve likely caught all of thebest movies of the holiday season(lookin’ at you,A Complete Unknown), why not start planning ahead? If you’re searching for inspo, have a look at the new releases we’re most excited to catch this year: A seasoned Vegas showgirl is in for a rude awakening when the world she’s known for over three decades comes to an abrupt end. Will she be able to find a life without the Razzle Dazzle?

name: 10+ Fun Immersive Experiences In NYC To Step Into Right Now
description: We love New York City, but sometimes it’s okay to want to step into another world! Immersive experiences have been popping up around the city for years now, and it’s because they’re so interactive and engaging! The beauty of these experiences though is the variation in how you’re actually “immersed. ” From visual/audio presentations taking up massive walls, to theatrical performances, to even one-of-a-kind dining experiences, there’s so many ways to dive head first into a mind-blowing escape from reality. With that said, here’s our list of the best immersive experiences in NYC to check out right now: Mercer Labsis a fairly new immersive experience museum, that just opened last year by artist Roy Nachum and business partner Michael Cayre.

name: ‘Good Night, And Good Luck’, Broadway’s Latest Frenzy, Steals Box Office Record From ‘Othello’
description: It’s a battle between Clooney and Washington. Good Night, And Good Luck, Broadway’s interpretation ofGeorge Clooney’s2005 film — which features the actor in his theater debut — is stealing the spotlight fromOthelloat the box office. The Moor (Denzel Washington) and lieutenant lago (Jake Gyllenhaal) have embraced a futuristic rendition of Shakespeare’s classic tale to much fanfare…and mighty pricey tickets nearing $1,000. (Don’t worry:Student tickets forOthelloare available for a mere $49. ) To accompany those high prices are even higher records: The2025 debutwas named the highest-grossing Broadway play in history, garnering a staggering $2.

description: Women are taking over sports, and we are here for it. The first woman-owned brewery in NYC,TALEA is known for its fruit-forward, approachable beers and its bright, design-forward taprooms.

NYC isfinallydefrosting after thePolar Vortex. If you want to catch the floral stunners for yourself, be sure to follow along with theCentral Park cherry blossom trackerandBrooklyn Botanic Garden cherry blossom trackerfor updates.

Located at43-50 Main St. in Flushing, in one of the most cultural neighborhoods in NYCis reason enough to take a trip! On Saturday April 12th, from 9:30 a.

description: Even the littlest New Yorkers want to take a bite out of the Big Apple — that’s where our list of things to do with kids in NYC comes in. You’re gonna need ‘em.

description: Music lovers’ favorite unofficial holidayRecord Store Dayis swooping back around onSaturday, April 12thand that means the return ofiNDIEPLAZA! As for this year’s musical lineup, it will be headlined by Swedish rock iconsThe Hivesand feature supporting sets fromScowl, the hardcore punk band from California, experimental hip-hop groupClipping. , reggae/dub artistPachyman, singer-songwriterZsela, Chicago post-punk outfitLifeguard, indie newcomersSlippers, and DJ sets fromChanel Beads,Yuno, andConfines + Ohaileigh(Saint Vitus).

name: These 4 Buzzworthy Books Deserve A Spot On Your April TBR
description: With April quickly approaching, it’s time for theSecret NYC Book Clubto choose our next gripping group read! Regardless of the book selected, there’s one thing that’s certain, all of these books are at the top of our To Be Read list. The novel, which will be released April 1, follows three siblings grappling with their father’s death, familial rivalries, and the magical talents they’ve been gifted.

name: This Irish Cocktail Bar In NYC & “World’s Best Bar” Winner Is Actually Named After An Irish Gang
description: Ever have an Irish Coffee atThe Dead Rabbitin FiDI? It’s kind of a magical experience. The belovedIrish cocktail barthat’s been racking up awards (including theWorld’s Best BarandBest Bar in North America) since 2013 should be at the top of everyone’s bar bucket list, especially withSt. Patrick’s Daycoming up. But have you wondered how the name came to be…because we must admit “The Dead Rabbit” isquitethe interesting name for a bar.

(No really, the spring is our favorite time to go). To add another reason to go, BBG is set to revive their moving sound installation calledloved. starting this weekend on March 15th.

Now thatspringis on the horizon and we havetulipsandcherry blossomson the brain, might as well embrace digging in the dirt, right? Plus, you can reap the benefits of a fig tree all summer long. If you already grow the beloved tree or you’re “fig curious,” theAstoria Food Pantryis inviting you to join the stick swap. Bring cuttings, snag some for yourself, and learn propagating tips for your own urban garden.

name: The Best Free Things To Do In NYC Right Now
description: There’s no arguing that NYC is on the pricer side, but trust us when we tell you there are plenty of coolfree things to do in NYCthat are worthy of your attention. Whether it’s exploringnew exhibitson free museum admission days, having a look atoutdoor installations, or joiningreading clubsat your localNew York Public Librarybranch, offerings abound. Sure, these perks might not be so easy to uncover, but that’s why we’re here. We’ve got your back! What catches your eye on our list of free things to do in NYC?

name: Reading Clubs In NYC And Other Literary-Focused Events For Bookworms
description: So, you finally finished the last chapter of your new book and youneedto vent. (We totally get it! ) Why not find areading club in NYC? They’re the perfect way to connect with a literary-minded community and gush over recent reads. Whether you’re meeting up with peers at anindie bookstoreor one of thecity’s most beautiful libraries, there are plenty of events worth bookmarking.

description: The Big East Conference is makingits presence felt in New York City and MSG, bringingelite college basketball action, exclusive events, and a wave of school spirit to the Big Apple. With teams like St. John’s, UConn, Villanova, and Georgetown battling for conference supremacy,this year’s tournament is set to be one of the most exciting in recent history. Off the court,NYC is becoming a Big East hub thanks to Starter, one of the most innovative and authentic sports apparel companies in the world. They will feature exclusivefan experiences, pop-up events, and special merchandise dropsthroughout the city.

name: The Second-Annual Ramadan Night Market Comes To Astoria Next Week
description: After a massive success last year,Astoriawill once again host its second-annualRamadan Night Market onThursday March 13th. The event is the work ofMalikah, anAstoria-based grassroots anti-violence and wellness organizationthat advocates against gender-based violence and hate crimes through self-defense training and community programming. The newfound annual tradition promotes “the best halal street food, Muslim-owned businesses, and a powerful sense of togetherness. ” Local businesses will congregate on Steinway Street in the heart ofLittle Egypt(between 25th and 28th Avenue) toshowcase diverse and delicious offerings and delights from the community. Although a vendor list is not yet available, notable businesses that participated last year include: Ramadan Night Marketstarts at 7:30pm and will run until 11pm.

name: 40 Marvelous Things To Do In NYC This March
description: NYC weather surely has its ups and downs, but we’ve already experienced some gorgeous temperatures that have inspired us to make all those plans we’ve been holding out on. From a reinvention of NYBG’s annual Orchid Show to spending your weekend brunching, here are tons of awesome things to do this March in NYC! Cue the leprechauns—St. Patrick’s Day is approaching onMonday, March 17th! In honor of our favorite green holiday we’ve rounded up our favorite ways to celebrate St.

name: 22 Fabulous Things To Do In Fort Greene, Brooklyn
description: Fort Greene is one of our favorite neighborhoods inBrooklyn, and possibly one of the borough’s best kept secrets. Situated between the Brooklyn Navy Yard, Downtown Brooklyn, Prospect Heights, and Clinton Hill, theneighborhood’s charming old brownstones and townhouses make it the perfect backdrop for a mid-day stroll,while a healthy culinary scene makes it a must-visit locale for mouthwatering eats you’ll be running to tell your friends about (and log on Beli). After all, there’s a reason it was recentlynamed one of the nicest places in America! Here areour favorite spots to eat, drink, hang, and spend your money(apologies in advance) in Fort Greene: Table Of Contents If you live more south then Head Hi is a bit of a trek north of Fort Greene Park, but it’s definitely worth it. Thislaid-back espresso bar and art-centric bookshopis the perfect place to caffeinate before a long day of exploring the neighborhood.

name: This Light Extravaganza In Queens Is Closing This Week
description: Get your walking shoes ready for a wondrous experience. Lektrik: A Festival of Lightsit has been here all season but it’s ending on March 23rd! See this spectacular experience which illuminates Queens Botanical Garden andyou can get tickets here. Step into various spaces modeled after cultures, landmarks and there are so many vibrant photo-ops to be had. This festival of lights has over40 stunning lamp scenes crafted by 150 artiststo explore.

name: You Can Mine For Glistening 500-Million-Year-Old Herkimer Diamonds In NY & Keep What You Find
description: We’re trying to fill ourspring bucket listswith new experiences and things we haven’t done before, and New York just so happens to be filled with exciting places to visit, like Herkimer Diamond Mines! Herkimer Diamond Mines are above ground “surface mines” that give visitors the unique opportunity to search for500-million-year-old Herkimer Diamond quartz crystalshiding in the rocks. According to the website, the“bedrock in which the quartz crystals are foundbegan forming approximately half a billion years agoas the Cambrian Sea lapped against the southern shores of the Adirondack Mountains. ” Sediments then slowly began to accumulate beneath the sea’s waters and were gradually compacted under the weight of thousands of feet of additional sediments, creating a layer of rock called dolostone. As water seeps through the pores of this rock and dissolves it forms small cavities in which Herkimer diamonds are found.

name: Experience Holland’s Breathtaking Tulip Fields Only 75 Minutes From NYC
description: Holland Ridge Farms, located about anhour and ten minutes from NYCin Cream Ridge, New Jersey, brings that tulip magic to the tri-state area. The farm was started by the Jansen family, whose patriarch immigrated to the U. S. from Holland in 1964. He learned how to grow tulip bulbs properly from his own father, and brought that knowledge right to NJ.

name: 50 Things You Can Get For Free For Your Birthday In New York City
description: Yes, you can actuallyhave your cakeandeat it toowhen it comes to celebrating your birthday in NYC because many spots around the city offerfabulous birthday freebiesto make your day a bit sweeter! Here are thebest gifts you can get forfreein NYC for your birthday. You can start your big day with a coffee and croissant, have a burrito for lunch, chow down on some wings for dinner, and finish the day off with a birthday cake–all for free! All the quick/to-go food and drink freebies you can get in NYC on your birthday are as follows: 🍪 Au Bon Pain– free sandwich or salad (sign up required) 🍿AMC Theatres– Stubs members get free popcorn (AMC Premiere Members get free popcorn + drink) (sign up required) 🥨 Auntie Anne’s– free pretzel (sign up required/must spend $10+ in previous year) 🍗 Buffalo Wild Wings– 6 freewings(sign up required) ✨ Cava– $5 credit (sign up required) 🍪 Chick-fil-A– free cookie or brownie (sign up required) 🍪 Chip City– free cookie (sign up required/valid 30 days after birthday) 🥑 Chipotle– free chips & guac (need to purchase something at least $5) 🥗 Chopt Salad– $3 credit (sign up required) 🍪 Crumbl Cookies– free cookie (sign up required/valid for 1 month) 🍰 DIG– free dessert (sign up required/valid for 30 days of birthday) 🥐 Dominque Ansel– freecroissantand small cup ofcoffeeat Flatiron location (sign up required) ✨ Fresh & Co– $5 credit (sign up required/valid only on birthday) 🍗Fuku– $5 credit (sign up required) 🧋 Gong Cha– $5 off a drink 🍩 Krispy Kreme– free box of original glazeddonuts 🧋 Kung Fu Tea– free bubble tea (sign up required) 🥯 Liberty Bagels– free rainbowbagelwith birthday cream cheese (valid on actual birthday) ✨ Maman– $10 credit (sign up required) 🍮McDonalds– free item of choice (sign up required) 🍩 Melt Shop– free milkshake (sign up required) 🌯 Moe’s– free cup of queso or guac (sign up required) 🍰 Ole and Steen– free small cake (sign up required) 🥤 PLNT Burger– free Oatasty Shake (sign up required) 🍿Regal Movies– free popcorn (sign up required) 🥤 Smash Burger– free milkshake (sign up required) 🧁 Sprinkles Cupcakes– free cupcake (sign up required/valid 30 days from email receipt) ☕️ Starbucks– free beverage of choice (valid on actual birthday/must have ordered within past year) ☕️The Bean– free coffee (sign up required) Why have just a small snack on your birthday whenyou can have a whole meal–for free? !

name: Candlelight Spring Concerts Are Blossoming Again In 2025 — Here Is A Look At The Upcoming Tributes
description: Ah, spring! The time for living in Gerard Manley Hopkins’ “lovely and lush” season, smelling flowers in bloom, and noticing a welcome change in the city’s temperature. Andthe Candlelight seriesis combiningbeautiful blossomswithmoving melodiesand thousands ofcandlesfor intimate concerts to pull music lovers out of their winter slumber. Candlelight concerts are all about creating anidyllic atmosphere. Spring is in itself the perfect atmosphere.

name: 9 Oscars Watch Parties In NYC To Bookmark For This Sunday’s Awards Show
description: Hollywood’s biggest night is coming up this Sunday,The Oscars, and we couldn’t be anymore excited! Even though the famous awards will be handed out across the country in Los Angeles, us New Yorkers still have a chance to take in the glitz of the big night right here in the city. While you’re stillcatching up on watching all of this year’s films, it’s time to plan where to watch the big night! Many of NYC’s restaurants, bars, and theaters are hostingspecial events, watch parties, and red carpets. Who will you be rooting for this weekend?

name: 30 Best Things To Do In NYC This Spring: The Ultimate Bucket List
description: Sure, sometimes it seems uncertain that the warmth will ever stick around long enough to properly enjoy it, but considering it’s almost spring and the sun has been shining quite a lot, it’s safe to say winter is almost behind us. Which is to say, it’s time to do some exploring! If you’re looking for plans during this magical time of year, here’s a list ofthe best things to see and do in NYC this spring! You can spend a beautiful day walking around NYC taking totally Instagrammable pictures with the pink and white blooms. Althoughpredictions are pointing towards a later mid-April bloom, we can still expect a city of full beautiful colors this spring.

name: Zoë Kravitz Spills Her Favorite Things To Do & Places To Eat In NYC
description: Zoë Kravitz’s ability to radiate cool girl energy is effortless, and our desperate desire to recreate it for ourselves is a never-ending feat. So when she spills on the places she likes to frequent in New York City there’s only one thing we’re going to do: give her our undivided attention. In a recentinterviewwith Elle regarding the 2024 release of her directorial debut,Blink Twice,Kravitz unveiled some of her favorite things you can find her doing and places you can find her eating around the city. Kravitz has been living in NYC for two decades–she was raised between Los Angeles, where her mom lived, and NYC andMiamiwhere her dad lived after her parents’ split. Sorry, though, toour friends over in LA–Kravitz may like NYC better (but who doesn’t?

name: ‘Mamma Mia’ Makes Its Return To Broadway Just In Time For Summer
description: Here we go again:Mamma Miais on its way back to Broadway this summer, and we certainly can’t resist her. Needless to say, the iconicBroadway show— the ninth longest-running of all time — is beloved for the quirky storyline and celebration ofABBAmusic. Mamma Miafocuses on a young woman on the eve of her wedding as she tries to uncover her father’s true identity. This quest sends three fellas from her mother’s past back to the island they all visited many moons ago, and of course, a whirlwind ensues. The beloved tale has made its way from the stage to screen, but it’s clear fans can’t resist its original format.

userId: Source / Candlelight at St. Ann & the Holy Trinity Church
name: One Of NYC’s Most Underrated Historic Treasures Lies In Brooklyn
description: If you ask us,St. Ann & the Holy Trinity Churchin NYC should be on the top of every things-to-do-in-Brooklyn list. Thanks to its extraordinaryvaulted ceiling,stained glass windowsby William Jay Bolton, and Gothic details, it’s an utterly striking building. And there’s even more beauty in its history. Its roots trace back to 1778, and its Episcopal congregation is one of the oldest of its kind in the US.

name: 20 Best Rooftop Bars In NYC For Cooler Weather
description: Some people might chalk uprooftop barsas a summer activity, but us New Yorkers love the sky-high views all year round. Whether you’re a seasoned veteran at rooftop partying, or just want to get a glimpse of the skyline during the cooler months, we got some options for you. We’re talking everything fromretractable roofstofireplaces and even igloos. Check them out below and plan your visit today! (Also note: thecozy Rockefeller Center chaletswon’t be around much longer, so if you’re interested in booking a reservation, do so ASAP!

name: The Jazz Age Lawn Party & Picnic Marks The Start Of Summer and Tickets Are On Sale
description: For years, the annualJazz Age Lawn Partyhas attracted all walks of life in NYC! So slip on your pearls and adjust that bow tie as you meet up for thistime-traveling festivalonJune 14-15andAugust 9-10! The Jazz Age Lawn party is now returning in this summer for its20th edition, bringing two-weekends worth of fun, music and food to NYC. Come summertime, like a seasonal migration, thousands of peopletake the ferry over to Governor’s Islandto party like it’s the roaring 20s! This nostalgic and notable experience will allow you to dress up in extravagant outfits and attend this decadent party.

userId: Source / Hard Rock Hotel New York
name: Earth Hour Meets Women’s History Month At This Special Candlelight Tribute Concert
description: OnMarch 22nd, the belovedCandlelight Concert seriesis heading to Hard Rock Hotel New York to commemorateEarth Hourin a truly unique way. You’re invited to celebrate the annual event byswitching off all non-essential lightsor appliances for one hour, experiencing instead the magic ofyour favorite pop hitsby way ofstring quartet: all set to the soft glow of candlelight. March is alsoWomen’s History Month, and this special concert is a perfect opportunity to honor and celebrate the incredible contributions of women in music. Featuring anall-female string quartet, don’t miss this enchanting evening that combines the beauty of music with the importance of sustainability. Candlelight: Tribute to Pop Greats, Presented by Hard Rock Hotelpromises a multi-sensory experience, a cultural moment, and a celebration all rolled into one, and guests are invited tograb a drinkat the venue’sRT60 Rooftop Bar & Lounge, too.

name: 55 Fabulous Things To Do In New York City This February
description: There are plenty of things to do in NYC in February that are worthy of a slot on your bucket list: fromdining experiencestonew performances,Valentine’s Day activitiesandLunar New Year celebrations, our guide has a little bit of everything. See what’s taking place and mark your calendars accordingly! While February seems like a good time to hole up in our tiny apartments,NYC’s Winter Outingwill make you say, “To Hell with the Polar Vortex. ” With2-for-1 Broadway tickets and museum tickets,as well asdiscounts to your favorite restaurants, there’s no better time to indulge in NYC culture. Have a look at each part of the promotion and book your outing now!

name: Become A Juror For A Day At This Live Theater Courtroom Drama In NYC
description: The Jury Experiencein NYC is an immersive courtroom experience where you’re not just watching the trial—you’re living it. Over the course of 60 minutes, an emotionally-charged hearing unfolds before your very eyes. You’ll find yourself on the jury as a key player,dissecting witness testimoniesand carefullyexamining the evidence. But just when you’re ready to reach a verdict, the defense challenges all your assumptions withunpredictable twists. On selected dates, this simulated courtroom drama is set to take place atIrondalein Brooklyn.

name: Discover This Dreamy ‘Bubble Planet’—A Perfect Spring Break Adventure For The Whole Family!
description: Over2 million‘Bubble Planet’fanshave attended the experience all over the world, includingMilan, London, Brussels, and Los Angeles. Now, the worldwide phenomenon has opened just outsideNYC! Thispastel-hued planet filled bubblesis theperfect adventure for spring breakand beyond. Enjoy the whimsicalBubble Planet: The Immersive Experienceand feel like a kid as you traverse through8 mesmerizing bubble-themed roomsthat ignite your imagination andbring out your inner child. If you’re ready to embark on an enchanting journey through abubble-filled planet,grab your tickets now!

userId: Source / Photo by Dan Shure / Secret NYC
name: Experience Lush Nightlife & Latin Dance at NYBG’s Orchid Show
description: TheNew York Botanical Garden’s Orchid Showis back, and you can experience it in a totally different way! Orchid Nights are the Garden’s exclusive evenings for the 21+ crowd, with cocktails, dancing and more taking place on select dates all spring. This year’s special theme is Mexican Modernism! Enjoy thesevibrant nights throughout the SpringonMarch 8, 15, 22, and 29 and April 5, 12, 18 19, 25, and 26. Relax in the warmth of Mexico without ever leaving the Bronx.

userId: Source / Photo: NYC Gov Parks / Malcolm Pinckney
name: 10 Magical Winter Hikes In & Around NYC To Do This Year
description: Winteris in full swing here in NYC, and even though it’s not snowy yet, we can’t help but think about or nextgetaway! Whether it’s escaping to a nearbyski resortor taking aday tripfor a hike, there are plenty of perfect spots forwinter treks within NYC itself (or an easy public transportation ride away)that will help you escape cabin fever in your apartment and enjoy nature. Since most of these are in the city, some are more of an “urban hike” (more walking vs. climbing or steep inclines), but great for enjoying the outdoors and getting some exercise nonetheless! Van Cortlandt Park is thethird largest park in NYC, taking up over one thousand acres in the northwest Bronx.

userId: Source / Candlelight concert at St Ann and the Holy Trinity Church
name: Joe Hisaishi’s Anime Scores Shine At This Enchanting Candlelight Concert In NYC
description: Known for its colorful visuals and complex story lines, anime is a type of Japanese animation loved by millions. Studio Ghibliis one of the most famous anime studios, and film composer Joe Hisaishi has scored many of their most iconic movies, fromSpirited AwaytoMy Neighbor Totoro. This season, anime fans can hear scores from these films and more performed on strings at this mesmerizingCandlelight Joe Hisaishi tributein NYC. Taking place inside the historicSt. Ann & the Holy Trinity Church, this Candlelight tribute to anime music is set to be an enchanting performance.

userId: Source / Photo Courtesy of Jazz Age Lawn Party
name: This Glamorous 1920s Jazz Age Lawn Party Celebrates its 20th Anniversary in NYC
description: What was once a small gathering on Governors Island, The Jazz Age Lawn Party is now one of the most beloved summer events in NYC. Having successfully attracted thousands of New Yorkers in past years, this Jazz and 20s-themed extravaganzacelebrates its 20th anniversary this summer! Thewaitlist is now openbefore tickets go on sale on March 13th. Be sure to take advantage of early bird pricing too! The Jazz Age Lawn Party has been consistently selected by theNew York Timesas one of the year’s most memorable events.

name: 10+ Best Things To Do In Harlem, NYC During Black History Month
description: Harlemis one of NYC’s most historic neighborhoods, rich in culture and lore dating all the way back to the 1920s-30s. Ever since the Harlem Renaissance drove many Black Americans to the area decades ago, it’s continued to besynonymous with music, literature, dance, art, and African American heritage. Sitting right above Central Park, the neighborhood continues to be buzzing today, welcoming some of the best museums, soul food, and African American institutions to the area. We’ve put together a list ofthe best things to do, see, and eat in Harlem next time you visit. Step foot into theoldest black-owned restaurant in NYCand the undisputed“Queen of Soul Food”at Sylvia’s Restaurant.

userId: Source / Church of the Heavenly Rest
name: Say “Hello” To A Spectacular Candlelight Concert Celebrating Adele In NYC
description: Adele may have finished her “Weekends With Adele” residency, butrumor has itthat the Candlelight concert series is bringing a captivatingtribute to Adele to NYC. The British singer-songwriter boasts16 Grammysandmillions of album sales, continuing to inspire female artists and shape the music industry. Known not only for herpowerful vocalsbut also for her haunting melodies, Adele’s chart-topping hits are iconic. Now, you can experience them in a whole new way—performed in classical form. Adele is no stranger to New York, having performed at Radio City Music Hall in 2015 and the Madison Square Garden the following year.

name: 20+ Best Date Ideas In NYC To Plan Right Now
description: Love is always in the air here in New York City — even when it’s notValentine’s Day! Whether you’re trying to impress someone on afirst date, or treating your partner to a fun night out, there are always so manythings to do in NYC! Fromintimate candlelit dinnerstoone-of-a-kind experiences, these date ideas are sure to ignite your romance and cement your love with NYC. Calling all artsy couples! Date Night at the Metis one of our favorite romantic date ideas, and it happens every Friday and Saturday night from 5 pm – 9 pm!

name: NYC Footy Debuts Its Singles Leagues, And We Think They’ll Become The Next Pickleball
description: If you thoughtpickleballwas a viable meet-cute, the debutNYC Footy Singles Leagueshave swooped in to give our beloved racket sport a run for its money. To get hearts racing on and off the field, NYC’s premiere soccer league is encouraging a little friendly competition amongst all skill levels. Why not enjoy a gameandpotentially meet someone in the process? (You were thinking about updating yourfitness routinefor the new year, so consider this an added perk! ) As mentioned, the next bestdate idea/NYC activity is happening right on the soccer field.

name: 10+ Cheap Things To Do In NYC While On a Budget
description: NYC is expensive, and finding the most funthings to docan be difficultwithout spending a ton of money. But fear not, we’re here to prove there’s plenty offreeand affordable activities to do that won’t break the bank! Fromart galleriestoNYC’s parks, there’s plenty of cheap options to enjoy without completely emptying your wallet. Whether you’re a local spending all of your money on rent (😅) or visiting the city on a budget, we’ve got some ideas for you. Bookmark thesecheap things to do in NYC right now: New York City’s museum scene is vast, and checking all of them off of your bucket list can get expensive quickly.

name: 32 Amazing Things To Do In Astoria, Queens
description: Table Of Contents Astoria is known for its rich Greek influence, but thismulticultural neighborhoodhas a lot more than some deliciousGreek foodto offer. Here’s our neighborhood guide to Astoria, soyou have the inside scoopon all the best places to go, things to see, and bites to eat. The VEGOIST @ No5 is the perfect spot to head to forbrunchfor two main reasons: 1. it has a fullveganmenu and a full regular menu, and 2. itoffers two different brunch deals–both of which are fabulous.

name: The Bronx Zoo’s Adorable Baby Silvered Langur Has Made Its Debut
description: Joining the beautiful newsnowy owls at the Bronx Zoo, is an adorable silvered langur baby. Born at the Bronx Zoo in November 2024, the baby monkey has made its debut, sporting an orange-colored coat. Silvered langurs are native to forest habitats in Asia, including countries like Brunei, Malaysia and Indonesia. Though adult silvered langurs are silver-grey in color like their name suggests, with dark grey bodies and silver-tipped hairs,silvered langur babies are born with a vibrant orange coat. As babies mature within the first three to five months after birth, their coat begins changing into the silver grey color to match the adults.

userId: Source / Radio City Music Hall. Credit: Unsplash/Drew Beamer
name: Music Lovers Don’t Need To Dig Deep To Find The Best Plans In NYC
description: NicknamedThe Big Apple, the city has endowed that juicy fruit with multiple meanings, especially after cementing itself as theworld’s jazz capital in the 1940s. It alsobred punk rock, fueled the explosion ofLatin music and disco, and remains sweet and ripe with innovation in the music industry. Whether you’re looking for new ways to get lost in it or hoping to revisit old haunts—fromindie sessions at Baby’s All Rightto uncovering how to get toCarnegie Hall—this is your list of things for music lovers to do in NYC. Jazz has been adding bebop energy to NYC’s music scene ever since the cultural renaissance that took hold in creative hubs likeHarlemandGreenwich Village. As a top destination for informal jam sessions and improvised melodies, New York has some ofthe best jazz clubsin the world.

name: Unveiled—A Sexy New Nightclub—Opens In The Heart of Williamsburg
description: It’s safe to say that Williamsburg’s nightlife has been notched up over the course of the past year or two (seeJoleneand Gabriela), and now there’s a new player in town—Unveiled. The sleek new bar/nightclub is seeking to redefine nightlife in their “sonic lounge” withimmersive curated sound, world class DJ bookings, and an electrifying social scene. Unveiled’s modern sophistication design comes from that of Maurizio Bianchi Mattioli and Angus McIntosh, whose world class space makes everything feel moody, intimate, and elevated. Full of dynamic lighting, intimate corners for conversation, muted jewel tones, and bold textures, it makes it easy to pick your vibe…from mingling by the bar to immersing yourself on the dance floor in the joint room. Not to mention Unveiled’s extreme focus on curating the best roster of DJs in the city.

name: Explore All 5 Love Languages With This Sultry Hotel Package For Valentine’s Day
description: Still unsure what to get your partner for Valentine’s Day? Why not book a intimate hotel stay at The Standard, High Line that touches on all of the five love languages? The hotel’s latest room package, in partnership with sexual wellness brandHELLO CAKE, is bringing the ultimate Valentine’s Day experience: “Speak the Languages of Love” Room Package. If you and your partner enjoy hibernating together and escaping from the outside world, this is the perfect staycation for you. And yes, the room package is filled with sensual delights designed to indulge in the comfort of your suite—no need to leave, not even for dinner as it will be served in your room.

name: The 30 Best Things To Do This Winter In NYC: The Ultimate Bucket List
description: While we fully embrace theholiday season in New York City, we can’t help but look ahead and think about the fresh blankets of snow headed our in the coming months! It might be easy to hibernate in our apartments, but trust us, this bucket list makes venturing out into the cold well worth it. Fromrooftop iceskating with breathtaking views of the cityto feasting on appetizers and cocktails in a cozy igloo, check out our list of thetop things to experience this winter in NYC. Put your ice skating skills to the test at one ofNYC’s many ice rinks. From gorgeous waterfront rinks to classic holiday hotspots, here are some of our favorites: If you think hot chocolate is the same everywhere, let NYC prove you wrong.

name: Where To Play Curling In NYC Right Now
description: Looking for your newestwinterhobby to get you through the chilling temperatures, how aboutcurling? Yes, the popular ice sport (that resembles much offrozen bocce) is becoming ever more popular here in NYC, with many pop-up curling lanes and curling clubs gaining popularity amongst the rise of the buzzing sport! Here’swhere to play curling in NYC right now, from lessons for beginners to leagues for “pros”! Open now, experience the magic of Bryant Park’s Winter Village, featuring theCurling Caféand cozyheated igloos. The Curling Café offers aniceless curling experiencewith 90 minute reservations open now, including a dedicated curling lane and a heated bubble igloo with food and drinks.

name: Off-Broadway Week Returns With 2-For-1 Theater Tickets
description: The show ain’t over yet:Off-Broadway Weekis swooping in to dazzle theater-goers with Disney tributes, TV parodies, mind-bending experiences, and so much more. ThoughBroadway Week 2025closes on February 9th, we assure you that venturing slightly off the Great White Way will yield some fantastic results. FromFebruary 17th to March 9th, NYC’s belovedOff-Broadway showsare offering two for the price of one, and who could say no to that? There are nearly 30 options to choose from, but things might look a little different this year, as theBlue Man Grouphad its final runat Astor Place Theatre. Not quite sure where to start?

name: 8 Captivating VR Experiences In NYC To Step Into Right Now
description: NYC is home to so many options of entertainment, it’s kind of overwhelming! From live entertainment likeBroadwayto individualized experiences likeescape roomsand virtual reality adventures, there’s so much fun to be had. We’re talkingthrilling and immersive games and simulationsthat can take you out of the Big Apple for a little while and into a brand new world. Perfect fordate night, awork outing, or even just a fun activity with some friends, the city’s VR studios are such a mesmerizing way to transport to a different environment without ever leaving NYC. Here’sour favorite places to book a VR experienceright now.

name: This Colorful Vending Machine Dispenses One-Of-A-Kind Mystery Art From Local NYC Artists
description: While we’re typically used to vending machines dispensing greasy snacks or MetroCards, NYC’s most creative vending machine Mystry Mart ischanging up the game and dispensing art! The vending machine is actually an art installation in and of itself, and is working to merge local creative talent with wandering art lovers. The machine housessmall paintings, photography, jewelry, prints, pins, keychains, figurines, and other one-of-a-kind odditiesyou won’t find anywhere else all made by local NYC artists. The caveat–contrary to your typical vending machine where you can see the items right through the glass, the art inside Mystry Mart is all wrapped up, soyou won’t know what you’ve received until you unwrap it–hence the “mystry! ” So if you’re someone who can never decide on what you want, or you just really love surprises, this is right up your alley.

name: Check Out 60+ Life-Sized Dinos At The Bronx Zoo Dinosaur Safari This Spring
description: Ready to live out that Jurassic Park dream? TheBronx Zoo Dinosaur Safariwill return this spring, and it promises to be bigger than ever before. One of the bestthings to do with kidsin NYC, the beloved traditionreturns April 12thwith plenty of prehistoric goodness for paleontologists of all ages. There are over 60 life-sized predators stationed across the zoo, waiting for you to get up close and personal. Plus, there will be11 newbies joiningthe fun.

userId: Source / Image courtesy of The Paley Center for Media
name: The Paley Center Brings Super Bowl Magic To NYC With Two Must-See Exhibits
description: As excitement builds forSuper Bowl LIX,The Paley Center for Media in NYC is kicking off the celebrations with two exclusive exhibits, offering football enthusiasts and casual fans alike a glimpse into the history and culture surrounding the Big Game. These exhibits will rununtil March 30, 2025, at the museum’s West 52nd Street location. This exhibit brings football history to life with astunning display of memorabilia. Visitors can marvel atthe legendary Vince Lombardi Trophyandchampionship rings from all 58 Super Bowl-winning teams. Rare game artifacts, including balls andjerseys loaned from the Pro Football Hall of Fame, offer a rare look into the championship legacy.

name: Bridgerton-Inspired Candlelight Concerts Continue To Charm NYC
description: Dearest Reader, Every viewer remembers them well — the lavish balls attended by members of the ton and the talentedstring quartetsreworking modern-day hits in the classical form. Since 2020, the famous period drama has been gripping audiences worldwide with its steamy scenes and nuanced take on Regency-era etiquette. AndCandlelight x Bridgertonin New York invites everyone to experience hearingfamiliar tracks performed on stringsfor the ultimate throwback to Mayfair’s sophisticated soirées. Quite a rare jewel is coming toSt. Ann & the Holy Trinity Church, indeed!

name: This Year In Classical Music: 13 Must-See Concerts In NYC
description: From itslegendary venueslike Carnegie Hall and Lincoln Center to housing world-class orchestras, NYC offers something special for every classical music enthusiast. This year, the classical scene promises an exciting blend ofstar-studded performancesby the New York and the Vienna Philharmonic, Lang Lang and London Symphony Orchestra, and undoubtedly, lots oftimeless masterpieces. Explore NYC’s rich tradition of symphonic excellence with our top classical concert picks throughout 2025. The New York Philharmonic has started the new year with a stellar lineup and diverse program. One of its highlights includes theLunar New Year Concertcelebrating the Year of the Snake on February 11, led byMaestra Tianyi Lu.

name: Escape to the Italian Alps At This Stunning Winter Pop-Up By Eataly
description: Eataly always brings authentic Italian products and experiences to the city, and it’s no different during winter. The incrediblewinter pop-up called ALPINA(at the SERRA rooftop by Birreria) is repping the après-ski lifestyle without having to hop on a plane, and it’s here all winter long! Inspired by mountain cabins, ALPINA’s winter escape offers a variety of programming, workshops, delectable foods, and seasonal drinks! As soon as you enter you’re greeted by the calmness of wintery snow-frosted naturalistic decor. Can we talk about all of the comforting food?

name: 20 Fun Winter Date Ideas In NYC & Romantic Things To Do
description: It’s nearly that time of the year when the wind is whipping, it’s slushy, and you can’t stop wiping your nose with your scarf. Withwinteron the horizon, we know how tempting it can be to lay low during the coldest of nights, but there’sso much to do right now, especially if you’re looking for a date night! To beat the winter blues, we’ve rounded upour favorite date night places and ideas to plan out this winter! Ice skating is an awesome way to spend the winter in NYC, butskipRockefeller Centerwhich is tourist-central andgo to the less popularBryant Park rink. It’ll be less crazy and give you more space to crash and burn because you inevitably forgot how to ice skate.

name: 15 Best Jazz Clubs In NYC For An Evening Of Live Music
description: NYC’s music scene is undoubtedly one of the best, thanks to the variations of genres you’ll find, theconcertsthat roll through our venues, and the intimatebarsandclubshosting local acts. It’s no secret thatNYC’s jazz scene is quite literally one of the best around, and evenincludes places Louis Armstrong and John Coltrane used to perform in. Perfect for a night of toe-tapping, or even an alternative date night idea, you can never go wrong with a little saxophone! These areour favorite jazz clubs in NYCfor live music! Originally opening in 1999,Smoke Jazz Clubrose to fame as one of NYC’s most iconic spots, before getting set back the past few years due to the pandemic.

name: 30 Fabulous Birthday Ideas For Celebrating Your Big Day In NYC
description: If you’re struggling to come up with ideas to celebrate, don’t forget—you live in the best city in the world! There’s no better place to usher in yet another year of life. Whether you’re looking to check something off your NYC bucket list, party the night away, or get out of the city, here some of our favorite ideas for a NYC birthday. CityDays Escape Scavenger Huntsallow thrill seekers to see sights and landmarks in the city while working on challenges and puzzles! You can uncover a murder mystery in Chelsea or discover the secrets of New Amsterdam and the history of NYC.

name: ​​A Pop-Up Edgar Allan Poe Speakeasy Opens In Staten Island For One Weekend Only
description: Get ready to enter the shocking world of Edgar Allan Poe at thisspooky pop-up speakeasy. Now open in Staten Island for a limited time, theEdgar Allan Poe Speakeasywill take you through afour-part interactive show and cocktail experiencespotlighting the influential author’s most famed works. The speakeasy is only at Pavilion on the Terrace fromJanuary 23 to 25, so be sure to act fast andget your tickets here! This Edgar Allan Poe Speakeasy is going to be to “die” for. Snag tickets here!

userId: Source / Photo via The Escape Game NYC
name: 16 Best Escape Rooms In NYC To Try With Friends And Family
description: Escape rooms are such a fun adventure for a group of friends or a family outing. Theimmersive experienceallows a team of players to work together to solve puzzles, discover clues, and complete tasks to finish the game’s mission within a set amount of time. Escape games put your problem-solving skills to the test and allow you to participate in an interactive experience that feels like a video game brought to life! If you’re looking for something out of this world, consider stepping into one of these rooms with your crew. To help you decide where to go, here are the best escape rooms in NYC.

name: 10 Best Things To Do In The Seaport Neighborhood, NYC
description: NYC’s historic districtThe Seaportgoes way back in time, and to this day continues to be one of our favorite quaint neighborhoods in all of Manhattan! The waterfront area wraps along the edge of the East River, offering some of the best skyline views you’ll find…especially of the Brooklyn Bridge and neighboring borough. The Seaport is most well known for itsmaritime heritage,charming cobblestone streets,old-fashioned buildings, andchicboutique shops and restaurants. During every season you’ll be able to find something to do in the area…and we’ve put a list together ofthe best things to do, see, and eat in The Seaport! Pier 17 is Seaport’s most incredible gem…home toall sorts of restaurants, attractions and of course The Rooftop at Pier 17.

name: A Complete Guide To New York Fashion Week 2025
description: New York Fashion Week is as glamorous as you’d imagine. From stunning designs and chic streetwear to celebrity appearances, the celebration transforms the whole city into a catwalk. Last year marked a first for the seasoned occasion: a round of free, public screenings of runway shows, courtesy ofCouncil of Fashion Designers of America (CFDA) and Rockefeller Center. (We’re hoping for the same this year and will keep you posted! ) New York Fashion Week (NYFW) is a longstanding tradition in NYC that takes place in bothFebruaryandSeptemberand allows designers to showcase their collections for the season ahead.

userId: Source / NYC GO & Off Broadway Week
name: Last Chance To See ‘Blue Man Group’ Before The Off-Broadway Hit Leaves NYC For Good
description: It’s the end of an era:Blue ManGroup, New York’sOff-Broadwaysensation, is retiring after an over-30-year run atAstor Place Theatre…but not without a celebration. The final show will take place onSunday, February 2nd,and the production’s co-founders, Chris Wink, Matt Goldman, and Phil Stanton, will return to the stage onFriday, January 24thfor a final sendoff. What better way to bid adieu to a NYC staple than with the OG creators? (Though it might not be easy to spot them among the other blue-clad performers, truth be told. ) “Blue Man Groupis unlike anything else in the world and is undeniably one of the most recognized and successful entertainment productions because of the hardworking cast, crew and creative team,”managing director Jack Kennsaid in a press release.

name: Escape To This Serene Wellness Retreat On The Shores Of The Hudson & Stay In A Riverside Cabin
description: Nestled on the shores of the Hudson River is the iconic luxury riverfront hotelHutton Brickyards, a 43-room riverside escapemade for getaways and unforgettable experiences. The property is well-versed in genuine relaxation and deep connections to nature, what with its luxury riverfront cabins, seasonal restaurants and bars, massage treatments,hikingin the 500-acre state park, and uninterrupted waterfront vistas. Though if you’re looking for more than just a serene getaway–something more along the lines of a full new year reset–then you’re in luck! Hutton Brickyardsjust launched a newwellness retreatseries, Hutton Health,a comprehensive approach to wellbeing that combines movement, nourishment, and daily holistic practices. The series is curated by professionally-trained Chef, Nutritionist, and Wellness Counselor Sarah Pachelli.

userId: Source / Courtesy: Matthew Murphy and Evan Zimmerman
name: The Best Broadway Shows Debuting In 2025
description: How about a round of applause for the stellarnewBroadway shows2025has to offer? This year’s Great White Way debuts run the gamut fromShakespeare retellingsto’80s remakesand evensci-fi fun from Netflix. Plus, you can expect plenty of star-studded actors venturing over from screen to stage this year, making the lineup even more alluring. And don’t forget,Broadway Week offers 2-for-1 ticketsfrom January 21st to February 9th, so snag ’em while you can. See you at the theater!

name: 13 Amazing Non-Drinking Activities In NYC We’re Totally Loving Right Now
description: Here’s to clean living. Whether you’re looking to form some new habits during Dry January, or are just trying to find some healthier and booze-free activities,NYC has plenty of entertainment for non-drinkers. Read on to discover some alcohol-free things to do in NYC! New York City presents a myriad oftop-notch art exhibitionson a global scale. Whether it’smodern artistic creations or captivating immersive encounters, there’s undoubtedly something captivating awaiting your attention.

name: 40 Fantastic Things To Do In New York City This January
description: Sure, everyone has “exercising more” and “eating better” on their list ofNew Year’sresolutions, but what about“experiencing more of what NYC has to offer”? Well, we’ve made the search this month a bit easier with our list of some of thebest things to do in NYC this January! Though we left the holidays in December, it doesn’t mean there isn’t plenty more winter fun to be had! And yes, we promise there are things worth getting out of your warm, cozy bed for during these colder months. Fromice skatingto beautiful experiences through nature at one of NYC’s botanical gardens,find our complete winter bucket list here.

name: A Thrilling New 6,500-Sq-Ft Gaming Spot Brings VR & Arcade Classics To Astoria
description: Looking for a bit of thrill and nostalgia? If so, you’re in luck! An exciting newinteractive gaming center andarcadeis opening next week, set to bring the perfect combination of both to the heart ofAstoria! Aptly dubbed Gaming City, the new spot will bring6,500-square-feet-worth of state-of-the-art 4 and 5D arcade gamesto locals and gamers willing to make the trek toQueens. (It’s located just steps from the 36th Ave.

userId: Source / Photo: NYC Gov Parks / Malcolm Pinckney
name: Embark On Free “First Day Hikes” At New York State Parks This New Year’s Day
description: If you have a few wellness resolutions in the works for2025, get to ’em ASAP with freeFirst Day HikesacrossNew York State Parks. To kick off the New Year, over 100 green spaces across the state are welcoming guests for awinter hiketo take in the scenes and get some fresh air. Most hikes are typically one to five miles and family-friendly, but check the location you’re interested in before you register. “There’s no better way to kick off the New Year than with family and friends at a First Day Hike to experience and enjoy the winter beauty of New York’s amazing scenic landscapes,”Governor Kathy Hochulsaid in a statement. The the First Day Hike concept originated in Massachusetts in 1992, and we’re glad to see the tradition has made its way across all 50 states, including the Empire State.

name: Best Places To Watch New Year’s Eve Fireworks In NYC This Year
description: We’re getting ready to wrap up our year here soon at Secret NYC, and whether you’re looking toparty your way into 2025, or enjoy the night with friends and family, it’s definitely a celebration! Like other holidays in NYC, thisNew Year’s will see a fair share of firework displays across the city. However, following an unseasonably warm fall, a subsequent drought, and multiple wildfires, plans look a little different this year. But don’t worry, there’s still plenty to look forward to as we welcome 2025. Here’s where to venture for a fun display: Normally, Grand Army Plaza in Brooklyn hosts an extravagant NYE fireworks show, however thisyear it’s been postponed by the ongoing drought.

name: 10 Whimsical Winter Getaways From NYC To Visit This Frosty Season
description: As thetemperatures dropand flurries begin to fall over the city, New Yorkers either hide from the cold in their five-story walk-ups or brave the frigid temperatures in their trusty black puffer coats. And while the winter brings with it the need tobid adieu to late sunsets, alas, seasonal depression begins to settle in. On the bright side, there’s endlessfun to be had in the wintertimetocombat those winter blues, fromigloo diningto tucking yourself away in abar with a fireplaceto escaping the city on a winter adventure! And, thankfully, we know a thing or two aboutthe best whimsical winter getaways from NYC. Findour favsbelow: Fromperfectly curatedholiday marketsto access to skiing, there’s a reason why many people make the trek to Burlington once the snow starts falling.

name: 40 Magical Holiday Things To Do In NYC This Year
description: Winteris coming soon to New York City, and that mean it’s nearly the most festive time of the year! The city shines particularly bright with lights illuminating every corner you turn. From the epic lights of Dyker Heights and Saks Fifth Avenue, to all the restaurants and rooftops that have transformed for the holidays—here are someof the most festive things happening this seasonto enjoy a truly magical holiday. One of theworld’s most famous illuminated Christmas treesstands tall in the heart of Rockefeller Center, and it’s most certainly an item to check off your NYC holiday bucket list. The massive Christmas tree is now shining bright, and features around50,000 multi-colored LED lights, as it sits in the Rockefeller Plaza every day during holiday season.

name: The Best Christmas Pop-Up Bars In NYC In 2024
description: As we near theholidays, we decided to put together a list of some of the most festive holiday-themed bar revamps around New York City. Each year various bars and restaurants goall out in holiday spirit decorations, transforming into magical winter wonderlands for a few months. Somerooftopsbecome alpine lodges or igloos, while other spaces focus more on kitschy and colorful decor. However, the one thing they all have in common are their fun and festive cocktail offerings! Whether you’re looking to enjoy some holiday cheer this season, trying to find the nextvenue for your holiday party, or just want to check out a new space, here are all of theholiday pop-up bars that should be on your winter bucket list!

name: The Best Hanukkah Events In NYC This Year
description: Thefirst night of Hanukkahis almost here, and there are plenty of ways to celebrate. From menorah lightings to dining at one ofNYC’s best kosher restaurants, our guide to the Festival of Lights doesn’t miss a beat. Prepare to light the eight candles, enjoy some deliciouslatkes, and enjoy this special time with loved ones. Here are the best events and happenings for Hanukkah this year: Brooklyn’s largest menorahwill be lit for Hanukkah in Grand Army Plaza this year, starting on the first nightDecember 25th. A tradition that has spanned the NYC neighborhood for over 30 years, it’s one of the largest menorah lightings in NYC.

name: The Best New Year’s Eve Events & Parties In NYC This Year
description: With2025 around the corner, it’s time to already start thinking about your plans of how to ring in the new year. Luckily NYC is no short of options, thanks to ourrooftop bars, electricnightclubs,great restaurants, and so much more. If you and your friends are still looking for something to do, we’ve got your back. These are the hottest parties andevents you should be attending this New Years’s weekend. One of New York City’s most iconic New Year’s traditions is watching the famous ball drop over Times Square.

name: Applebee’s Times Square Is Offering A $729 Dinner With Views Of The Ball Drop On NYE
description: If you love watching the ball drop but aren’t willing to strap on one of those adult diapers and wait out theNew Year’s Eve festivitiesto keep your spot, there’s another way to catch the drop in person, so long as you’re willing to dish out $729… Applebee’s is once again offering its hilariously iconicNYE dinner. The all inclusive evening will run you a checkstarting at $729. But before you decline, you may want to hear what’s included. Located in the heart of Times Square, on 42 Street between 7th and 8th Avenues, diners are located a stone’s throw away from all the magic going on inTimes Square. On top of the unbeatable location, in the comfort of the indoors (with accessible bathrooms at your leisure) and apersonal escort to the street for a live viewing of the New Year’s Eve Ball Drop, the night includes a chef’s selection buffet and passed hors d’oeuvres, an open bar of top shelf liquors, a table dedicated solely for desserts, NYE party favors, live entertainment and a house DJ, and of course, a champagne toast at midnight.

name: 15 NYC Businesses Where You Can #ShopLocal For Last-Minute Holiday Gifts
description: The holiday seasonis officially here! Whether you’re looking to do some last-minute shopping, or you want to explore the best goods from local artists within the five boroughs, there’s plenty to put on your list! As the holidays get closer, many local boutiques and stores have extended hours and rushed shipping options to help you check everyone off your list, plus you’ll be able to support the amazing businesses that make the city what it is. Here are just a few of our favorite local spots to help you finish off your shopping list this year! (And be sure to stop by our favoriteholiday marketsaround the city for even more local offerings.

userId: Source / Photo: Bank of America Winter Village at Bryant Park
name: 16 Best Places To See Santa In NYC This Christmas
description: While your little ones are busy crafting their holiday wishlist, map outwhere to see Santa in NYCfor a festive outing. Every year, Kris Kringle descends from theNorth Pole(which isactuallylocated in Upstate, NY) and delights little New Yorkers with a quick catchup and a photo. It’s tradition, and who could blame him for wanting to venture to NYC during the holidays? In betweentree lighting ceremoniesand pitstops atNYC’s best holiday markets, make sure to set aside some time for the man in the red suit. Macy’s annual Santaland is tradition in NYC, and the winter wonderland — complete with holiday decor, train displays, and of course, Saint Nick himself — opens onNovember 29th.

name: System of a Down Announce 2025 Shows Including A Stop At Metlife Stadium
description: Wake up! System of a Down fans rejoice, the band has unveiled tour dates for a trio of cities in 2025. Within days the Metlife Stadium show on August 28th was sold out and Aug. 27th was just added for fans in the tristate area! It’s been over a decade since System of a Down performed in New York.

name: NYC’s Most Secretive Christmas Market Is Hidden Beneath This 103-Year-Old Church
description: Whether you’re hoping to escape the crowds of themore popular marketsor you’re in search of aunique giftthat you can’t find elsewhere, we’re spilling the secret on NYC’s most under-the-radarChristmasmarket. Tucked away on 48th Street in Midtown East lies theChurch of Sweden. But this isn’t just a historic NYC church, no this building is home to a hiddenJulmarknad/Christmas market. Upon entering the 103-year-old church, you’ll take a quick right into the library. I was immediately struck by the church’s inviting and warm atmosphere, as the smell of cardamom and saffron buns floated to me.

userId: Source / Courtesy: James Mangold, Searchlight Pictures. © 2024
name: Here Are The Best Movies To See This Holiday Season In NYC
description: Once the feasts have been consumed and presents have been unwrapped, why not grab tickets to the movies? Theaters in NYCare open and waiting for spectators, and a good story could be the perfect way to wrap up yourholidayfestivities. There’s plenty on tap this year: a Bob Dylan biopic, a retelling of a horror classic (yes, horror), and even choices for the kiddos…or the young at heart. Swap the pepperminthot chocolatefor some popcorn and enjoy these new and recently released films. A sensation in its own right, thisWickedremake will have you singing along with Glinda and Elphaba long after the story’s over.

name: The Revamped 2025 FIFA Club World Cup Is Heading To The NY Area
description: Soccer fans will get a kick out of this exciting news: the reimagined2025 FIFA Club World Cupis making a MetLife pitstop. Not to be confused with the World Cup, this particular tournament features 32 teams from the six continental confederations —AFC, CAF, Concacaf, CONMEBOL, OFC, and UEFA— and sees the best club sides over the past four seasons competing for the top spot. “This new FIFA competition is the only true example in worldwide club football of real solidarity and inclusivity, allowing the best clubs from Africa, Asia, Central and North America and Oceania to play the powerhouses of Europe and South America in an incredible new World Cup which will impact enormously the growth of club football and talent globally,” FIFA President Gianni Infantino said in a statement. If you thoughtMetLife Stadium hosting the 2026 World Cup Finalwas a treat, consider this an even bigger reason to celebrate. There will be 63 matches featuring 32 teams from six confederations — AFC, CAF, Concacaf, CONMEBOL, OFC, and UEFA — who are all aiming for the top spot.

name: SKIMS Opens A 6,500-Square-Foot Multi-Level Flagship On NYC’s Fifth Avenue
description: Hold tight, because SKIMS’ first NYC flagship just opened along Fifth Avenue, stretching three levels high of their signature and limited edition styles. The company initially teased their NYC opening to Instagram, posting a series of content declaring “SKIMS loves New York. ” A new post today shared that the storefront has officially opened at 647 Fifth Avenue. According toBusiness of Fashion,the store spans 6,570 square feet. The building was former home to Italian luxury brand, Versace.

name: 25 Things To Do In NYC In 2025 That You Absolutely Cannot Miss
description: Let the countdown to 2025 — and exciting newthings to do in NYC— begin! Our next trip around the sun will provide plenty of opportunity to make the most out of our city, fromtheater visitsandoutdoor excursionstoexhibit-hoppingandcool concerts. Secret NYC’scarefully curated list of debuts, recent openings, and classic destinations are must to kick the new year off right. Since we know calendars fill up quickly, make sure these selections snag a spot on your 2025 bucket list. Cheers to an amazing new year!

name: 15 Best Movie Theaters In NYC To Watch The Latest Flick
description: Whether it’sraining outsideor the sun is shining bright, there’s never a bad time to catch the latest movie that everyone’s chatting about! Although some say movie theaters are on their last leg, NYC is proud to stand up against the streaming giants, thanks to the variety of great theaters at our disposal. These are thebest movie theaters in NYC to catch a film! With 16 locations across NYC, Regal Movie Theaters are ‘ol reliable. Plus, they’re some of the most affordable!

userId: Source / Courtesy: Warner Bros. Home Entertainment, Inc.
name: Here’s Where To Watch Your Favorite Christmas Movies In NYC This December
description: Wondering where towatch Christmas movies in NYC— besides the comfort of your cozy apartment? Fortunately, NYC is turning into a winter wonderland, and that includesmovie theaters, famous attractions, and beyond. Special Christmas screeningsare taking place throughout the city, and we’ve rounded up a few of our favorites thisDecember, if you’re searching for inspo. While you’re busy crafting yourholiday to-do list(and your wishlist for Kris Kringle) make sure to check out these cool screenings. And, if you’re up for a mini escape,the nation’s first-ever Christmas movie trailis taking place right outside NYC.

name: Score 25% Off Your Stay At These Hotels During NYC Hotel Week 2025
description: If you’ve been wanting to plan a winterstaycationin the city, you’re in luck–the absolute best time to catch a good deal at some ofthe coolest hotels in NYCis creeping up! New York City Tourism + Conventions, the official destination marketing organization and convention and visitors bureau for the five boroughs of New York City, is looking forward to welcoming backNYC Hotel Weekthis January through February. For its fourth iteration, the program will run fromJanuary 2nd through February 9th, 2025,offering a 25% savings on standard room rates at more than 130 of NYC’s best hotels, including Ace Hotel Brooklyn, Conrad New York Downtown, Hotel Indigo NYC Financial District, Hyatt Regency JFK Airport at Resorts World, Le Meridien New York Central Park, Luma Hotel Times Square, and more! Nancy Mammana, CMO and Interim CEO of New York City Tourism + Conventions, stated: Now in its fourth year, our NYC Hotel Week program offers some of the best rates of the year to travelers and locals alike. As occupancy levels continue to soar, New York City’s hotel sector is as vibrant as ever, and NYC Hotel Week offers visitors a range of ways to experience it—from luxury stays to boutique experiences—at an incredible value this winter.

name: This Extraordinary Candlelight Concert Presented By Mastercard Will Take Place 1,100 Feet Above NYC
description: The holiday season in NYC is all about creating memories that last a lifetime. And onTuesday, December 17th, Mastercard cardholders will have the opportunity to do exactly that with aCandlelight holiday concert, presented by Mastercard, taking place1,100 feet above Manhattan. For one night only,cardholderscan experience an exclusive Candlelight concert at one of New York’s most iconic venues. To the backdrop of hundreds of flickering candles with panoramic skyline views, a word-class pianist will bring to life a medley of holiday classics atEdge NYC, thehighest outdoor sky deckin the city. Mastercard has a rich history of partnering with some of New York City’s most iconic and innovative events and venues—all focused on getting cardholders closer to their passions through priceless experiences.

name: The Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree Will Be Lit Tonight
description: As we anxiously await thisyear’s tree arrival, we can look forward to the annual tree lighting ceremony that takes over West 49th and 50th streets and Fifth and Sixth avenues with tens of thousands of multi-colored lights. If you’re wondering about all the details of this year’s tree lighting, visits, etc. , we’ve got your questions answered! The 2024Rockefeller Center treearrived in the plazaonSaturday, November 9th. Its arrival brought about family-friendly activities to kickstart the holiday season, including story times, pics with Santa, and performances from Rock and Roll Playhouse.

name: NYC’s New Ice Cream Shop And Bookstore Hybrid Is The Sweetest Spot Uptown
description: Whether you’re craving confections or looking to kick back with a bestseller,Fountain BookshopinWashington Heightswill gladly assist. The newly-opened storefront brings together the best of both worlds: anindependentbookstoreand anice cream shop— two necessary ingredients for the uptown neighborhood. “We need a place that’s not in our homes where we can go, look at titles, let our minds think about something big — or think about nothing for 10 minutes and just look at covers,” says ownerKarah Pinto, who is also the owner and executive chef of the neighboringDutch Baby Bakery. Her latest venture is the marriage between her two careers as an English professor-turned pastry chef. And without knowing it, Karah managed to sprinkle her roots into the mix to add some flavor to the sweet space.

name: Ice Bumper Cars Are Returning To Prospect Park Next Month
description: Let’s face it: nowinter bucket listin New York is complete without the city’s trendiest cold-weather activity, a. k. a. ice bumper cars. Ever sinceBryant Parkdebuted this adorable feature a few years ago, the cars have been bumpin’ their way across the city.

name: The Saks Fifth Avenue Holiday Light Show Has Been Cancelled This Year
description: While there are plenty of things to do inNYC this Christmas, we regret to inform you that theSaks Fifth Avenue Holiday Light Showwill not be one of them — a fact travel bloggers and NYC influencers revealed on Monday, November 11th.
