The historic yard,sprawled across 300+ acres,is currently a hub of industrial and innovative activities and among the most intriguing places to visit in the Big Apple. From exploring its historic naval hospital tomesmerizing views of the Manhattan skyline, there’s plenty to do when visiting the Brooklyn Navy Yard. Background on the Brooklyn Navy Yard The US Navy actively used the yard from the early 1800s to the 1960s tomanufacture many important marine giants, such as steel ships and battleships.

name: Discover the Timeless Beauty of St. Patrick’s Cathedral in the Heart of New York City
description: Rising proudly into the sky with its soaring spires, St. Patrick’s Cathedral commands attention. This marble clad neo-Gothicmarvel spans an entire city block and is thebiggest Gothic Revival Catholic cathedral in North America. Completed in 1879 and officially designated aNational Historic Landmarkin 1976, it draws over five and a half million visitors annually, making it a must-see destination in New York City. St.

name: 38 Glorious Things To Do In Greenpoint, Brooklyn
description: Greenpoint, Brooklyn’s northernmost neighborhood, isone of our favs for many reasons. For starters: it’s full of great food, and everyone knows the way to someone’s heart is through their stomach! But beyond that it’s also a super creative neighborhood home to eclectic shops and tons of unique places to hang. And the good news is, we’re not gatekeepers. We created a guide to Greenpoint so that the next time you’re there you know exactly where to go, what to do, how to enjoy all the neighborhood has to offer.

name: 16 Exciting Things To Do In Hudson Yards
description: Table Of Contents Often viewed as“a city within a city,”Hudson Yards boastsimpressive architecture, over 100 shops and restaurants, a cultural center, and some of NYC’s most iconic destinationssuch as Edge andThe Vessel. There’s a seemingly endless amount of things to do in the neighborhood, and to help you figure out where to head to first, we’re sharing the best of the neighborhood. Here’s our inside scoop: NYC’s Hudson Yards is full of things to see and do! From one of the most notableobservation decksto a massiveshopping mall, there’s plenty of things to do in the neighborhood! Check out our favorites below.

name: Times Square: Ultimate Guide for First-Time Visitors
description: One of the world’sbusiest pedestrian areas, Times Square is a symbol of New York City’s vibrancy, bustling with activitiesaround the clock. Once known asLongacre Square, it was renamed in 1904 after the headquarters of The New York Times was moved to the newly built Times Building, marking the beginning of its transformation into theiconic hubit is today. It’s now known for itsbright lights andiconic flashy billboardsand draws millions of visitors each year to itsstores,restaurants, and attractions. Alongside numerous businesses offering 24/7 services, Times Square is also the hub of the ‘Broadway Theatre District’ and a prime center of the world’s entertainment industry. Located inMidtown Manhattan, the history of Times Square dates back to the early 20th century when it was commonly known as the ‘Longacre Square.

name: The Best Places To Jet Ski Near NYC For Sightseeing
description: Summeris officially here, and we’re ready to get on the water and grab some picturesque views of NYC! Whether you’re an adrenaline junky or just looking for something fun to do in NYC, there are plenty of places to jet ski in NYC that are both thrilling and full of incredible skyline angles. In this guide, we put together or favorite companies that offer jet ski rentals and even guided tours! Here are favorite spots to jet ski this summer. The team atNew York Harbor Jet Skiwill certainly provide you first-class service with their experienced jet skiing knowledge.

name: The Best Festivals In NYC Happening This Summer
description: Here in NYC, there’s always something new to see! From rotatingart installationstofree events around the city, there are so many happenings to match any style and personality. Now thatsummeris in full swing, there are tons of event series and festivals you should bookmark on your calendar. Let’s dig into our favorite festivals in NYC that are either happening now or coming up later this summer! The Tribeca Festivalreturns to NYC this June, running fromJune 5 – 16!

name: A 2-Week Pickle Pop-Up Returns To The LES This June
description: Listen up pickle lovers–we have some news that’s bound topickleyour fancy! Atwo-week pickle pop-up is once again heading our way! Grillo’s Pickles will be hosting aGrillo’s Pickle World pop-up in theLower East Sidethis June, and if you’re a pickle lover than we’d say it’s a pretty big dill. The pop-up will feature tons oflimited-edition pickled foods,exclusive merch, and more! One of the merch collabs you can get your hands on during the two-week long pop-up Grillo’s Pickles Pickle Pop-Up will be withCheatin Snakes,a streetwear brand that focuses on creating a community of like-minded outcasts through clothing and novelty items.

name: You Can Do Sky-High Pilates, Cardio Kickboxing, & More At NYC’s Edge This Summer
description: Edge recently announced they’d be bringing back their popular Sky High Yoga to provide incredible yoga classes on thevery top of the city. Butthis summer they’re offering way more than just that! Beyond yoga, Edge just announced they’re now adding an array of new programming includingEquinox signature classes,pilates, athletic conditioning, cardio dance, and cardio kickboxing classesled by expert Equinox instructors to their weekly fitness lineup. The new classes will be added to the schedule beginning Friday, June 7th. Tickets will go on saleThursday, May 30 at noon for $90.

name: This UFO Fair 2 Hours From NYC Shines A Spotlight On The Town’s Alien History
description: Feeling extraterrestrial? New York’s town of Pine Bush will be the coolest place in the galaxythis summeras the annualPine Bush UFO Fair is set to make its returnthis Juneon Saturday, June 1st. Now in its 13th year, the fair allows visitors to step into the cosmos ascosplay characters and extra-terrestrials of all shapes and sizestake over the town’s Main Street. Beyond the unidentified other-worldly beings, the fair will also have games and activities and vendors selling food and unique and eclectic craft vendors selling, of course,UFO-themed novelties. Visitors are encouraged to attend in costumeif they are comfortable doing so!

name: Get into Vacation Mode at Brookfield Place All Summer Long
description: Celebrate Pride with interactive installations and music; enjoy a new photography exhibit as part of Photoville Festival; or cool down with refreshing cocktails by the waterfront and enjoy NYC’s epic summer sunsets. Brookfield Placeis a hidden gem in Lower Manhattan is the best place to be this season! During Pride Month there is so much to do! Engage with two interactive installations that encourage visitors to reflect on diversity and empower each other. Artist Matthew Hoffman’s installation, aptly called “You Are Beautiful,” invites visitors to spread positive affirmations and love to the community.

name: Thousands Of Toy Elephants Will Fall From NYC Skies Tomorrow
description: Forget about it raining cats and dogs, it’ll be raining elephants tomorrow atNYC’s sixth annual Dumbo Drop! The quirky tradition, that releases thousands of toy elephants from rooftops over Washington Street in Brooklyn will return to DUMBO tomorrow,Friday, May 31, 2024. Every year a different artist designs the elephants’ parachute. This year’s selected designer isNoah Lyon. This year’s Dumbo Drop will be split into two different times:5 pm and 7 pm.

userId: Source / Photo: Governor's Ball Music Festival/Charles Reagan
name: Governors Ball Music Festival 2024: Everything You Need To Know
description: New York City’s hottestmusic festivalis making its annual return this year, featuring music’s largest names, tasty food, and so much more! This year marks the 13th Governors Ball here in NYC and we couldn’t be any more excited for June! As the festival approaches in the next few weeks, we’ve put together a guide of everything you need to know before Gov Ball: This year’s Governors Ball will take place fromFriday, June 7 to Sunday, June 9. Governors Ball will once again take place atFlushing Meadows Corona Parkthis year! Last year the festival debuted in this brand new location after formerly calling Citi Field and Randall’s Island home in previous years.

name: Bryant Park’s Iconic Free Movie Nights Are Back For The Summer
description: Always a warm-weather staple in NYC, the free Bryant Park Movie Nights will return once again for its 31st anniversary. In fact, it’s thepark’s longest-running program. Similar to last year, they will be back for the start of the summer in June. The screenings will take place on Monday evenings from June 10 through August 14=2. “We’re excited to bring back the widely popular Paramount+ Movie Nights this summer after reaching hundreds of thousands of fans last year,” said Domenic DiMeglio, Chief Marketing Officer and Chief Data Officer, Paramount Streaming.

name: Here’s Where To Play Pickleball In NYC Right Now
description: Last summer’s craze is now a full blown sensation here in NYC, andpickleball has taken over the sports scene here in the city! After the smashing success ofWollman Rink’s pickleball court in Central Park last summer, new courts have popped up all around NYC, making it accessible as ever to play the emerging sport! Whether you’re a beginner looking to get your toes wet or a full on player, here’swhere to play pickleball in NYC right now! Returning for another year, Wollman Rink in Central Park has been transformed into 14 pickleball courts for the summer! It’sthe largest pickleball installation in the entire Northeast, and it’s open seven days a week from 8 am – 9 pm, from now through early fall.

name: NYC’s Hottest New 104K-Square-Foot Venue Heads To The Brooklyn Navy Yard
description: NY-based powerhouse TCE Presents and the UK’s Broadwick group–two of the most culturally impactful independent curators of live events–are teaming up in a transatlantic partnership tobring Brooklyn Storehouse to TheBrooklyn Navy Yard,a 104,000-square-foot events venue. TCE Presents has been transforming New York nightlife for the past decade,producing 150+ showers per year (including fashion and corporate activations) at groundbreaking venues led by the house and techno focused event brand Teksupport. They’re also responsible for the US editions of iconic overseas brands such as CircoLoco and Time Warp. Broadwick, on the other hand, has been a pioneerin the evolution of live experiences in the UK, acquiring 30+ venues and entertainment spaces and selling over one million tickets per year. They’ve also developed some of the world’s most inspiring cultural brands, including Printworks London and DRUMSHEDS, among others.

name: Coney Island’s Luna Park To Debut NYC’s First Electric-Powered Go-Karts
description: Coney Island’sLuna Park officially reopened for the season in March. However, the park will debut its brand new Go-Kart attraction this Friday, May 24th. Called Electric Eden Raceway, adrenaline junkies will get to driveNYC’s very first electric-poweredGo–Karts! It’s name hails from Luna Park’s original nickname, “Electric Eden,” due to all of the park’s impressive lights. Through the racetrack’s video mapping gamification, drivers will be locked in for an epic experience from the starting point to the finish line.

name: There’s A Limited Deal On Tickets To This Beloved Jazz Age Lawn Party Which Is Almost Here In NYC
description: For years, the annual“]Jazz Age Lawn Partyhas attracted all walks of life in NYC! So slip on your pearls and adjust that bow tie as you meet up for thistime-traveling festival soononJune 8th – 9thandAugust 10th – 11th! The Jazz Age Lawn party is now returning in June for its 19th edition, bringing“]two-weekends worth of nostalgiato NYC. Come summertime, like a seasonal migration, thousands of peopletake the ferry over to Governor’s Islandto party like it’s 1920! Starting at 11am, this nostalgic and notable experience will transport you to a time period in American history with such a substantial societal and economic change.

name: 11 Best Outdoor Flea Markets In NYC To Shop At Right Now
description: Flea markets are arguably some of the best places to find interesting treasures. Whether you’re looking for something vintage, unique, or downright quirky, you’re bound to find something at a flea market, and NYC’s markets are one of the best ways to get a closer look at the city’s culture. A sunny,weekend afternoonis best spent outdoors exploring, so be sure to check out one of theseoutdoor flea markets in NYC. Returning again toMidtown’sBryant Park this year is the spring version of their wildly popular Winter Village. This market will focus on one-of-a-kind handmade items, featuring up to 150 local vendors, andwill only be open on weekends in May.

name: NYC Pride March 2024: Everything You Need To Know
description: Juneis almost here, and with it comesPride Monthand the chance tocelebrate and show our support for the LGBTQIA+ community! And NYC Pride March, one of the largest annual Pride parades in the world, has revealed its 55th annual event details. This year’s Pride March will happening onSunday,June 30, 2024starting at11 am! The 2024 theme is“Reflect. Empower.

name: Here’s A Complete Guide To Fleet Week NYC 2024
description: One thing that always lets us know thatsummerfun is on its way in NYC is theannual NYC Fleet Week. During the week, multiple ships and thousands of sea service members are set to visit the five boroughs offering everything from public ship visitations to a variety of military demonstrations. Learn all the information you need to know aboutthis year’s Fleet Week below! First held in 1982, NYC Fleet Week is aweek-long celebrationthat invites participants from all around the world to enjoy various events held tohonor the US Navy, Marine Corps, and Coast Guard. During the week, plenty ofships from the US Navy, Coast Guard, and sometimes ships from foreign navies visit New York City and dock in various locations around the city’s waterfront.

name: You Can Pick Your Own Sunflowers At This Farm In NJ
description: For those looking topick their own fresh sunflowers, Happy Day Farm in New Jersey is a must-visit, and even if you decide not to take any home (though, whywouldn’tyou? ) the sight of a sunflower field alone is worth the visit. They officially open for sunflower season onJuly 3rd, 2024and will remain open for picking through August 25th, 2024. Sunflowers tend to bloom between the middle of summer through early autumn. And we can’t wait to see ayellow wonderlandat the farm in a few months!

name: You Can Stay In A Real-Life Version Of The X-Men Mansion Less Than 1 Hour From NYC
description: As part of Airbnb’s brand new experience categoryIcons, that lets legendary stars in music, film, television, art and sports become your host, you can stay inside areal-life recreation of the X-Mansion from Marvel’s Animation series X-Men ’97. The sprawling mansion is fit for eight guests with four bedrooms, five beds, and two and a half baths. Located in New Castle, New York,under an hour drive from the city, all mutants are invited to discover just how special they really are at Xavier’s Institute for Higher Learning, explains Airbnb. The mutant sleepover will feature a student orientation, before you completecool experiments in Beast’s lab, take fighting lessons from the combat professors in the Danger Room, andlearn about your mutant superpower in the War Room thanks to Cerebro. You’ll even leave with your very own diploma and class photo!

name: 24 Unique Things To Do On City Island, The Bronx
description: Outside of residents from the Bronx, not many people know about this small island adjacent to the borough, affectionately titledCity Island. A quaint but bustling neighborhood full of delicious seafood restaurants with waterfront views of the Long Island Sound, here is what you should do on the special occasion that you find yourself on City Island. Table Of Contents An unpretentious and family-friendly spot, Seafood City caters to both adults and kids alike with its onslaught ofclassic seafood options and arcade games. On their seaside outdoor seating, munch on some clams and shrimp. If you’re the right height, try out one of their mini rides!

name: 10 Unforgettable Things You Must Do On Your Next Trip To Italy
description: Sure we’re experts on all thingsNYC, but we’ve gotfriends all around the globekeeping us up to date on the best happenings in the world’s biggest cities. When traveling, it’s important to make time for the typical tourist spots and landmarks, but we understand wanting to travel like a local. So if you find yourself in Italy on your next trip abroad, be sure not to misshidden gemsthat are only found off the beaten path, likebeautiful concerts in jaw-dropping venues that are illuminated by candlelightor hole-in-the-wall pizza shops. Italy is a country full of history, and with it some of the world’s most famous landmarks and monuments. Here are some of the most important monuments, alongside under the radar venues, showcasing Italian architecture that you can’t miss while traveling around the country.

name: 15 Best Things To Do For Cinco De Mayo In NYC This Year
description: Cinco de Mayo commemoratesMexico’s victory against France in the 1862 Battle of Puebla. Throughout history, Cinco de Mayo’s importance has dwindled in Mexico but substantially grown in the US, as a way for Mexican-Americans to celebrate their cultural heritage and show off their pride. Though the day has since been commercialized, it’s important to acknowledge and understand the origin of the celebration. Here are thebest ways to spend Cinco de Mayo in NYC: East Village’s Superbueno was just recentlyranked North America’s second best bar, and deserves your visit this Cinco de Mayo! Their playful cocktail menu full of eye-opening flavors (Roasted Corn Sour, Mole Negroni, Mushroom Margarita) and assortment of tacos are sure to hit the spot.

name: 10 Best Pick-Your-Own Fruit Farms Near NYC To Visit
description: Nothing quite saysspringandsummerlike picking out some fresh fruit for you to devour! Just outside of NYC lies many farms and orchards growing the finest treats that nature has to offer! Fromjuicy apples, to sweet strawberries, to even succulent peaches, these picturesque fruit-picking destinations are the absolute best! Get ready to pluck and taste because it’s worth theday triporweekend getaway! Fishkill Farms and their“Pick Your Own” processmake this spot one of our favorites.

name: Free Kayaking Will Return To Brooklyn Bridge Park For The Summer
description: The city’s summer water activities have officially commenced. Brooklyn Bridge Park Boathouseis bringing their kayaks out for visitors to enjoy the simple pleasure of kayaking, for free, with breathtaking views of the skyline. Weather permitting, the boathouse will offer free sessions from Pier 2 onWednesdays, Thursdays, & Saturdays starting May 29th through the end of September. You don’t need any prior kayaking experience to take one out for a spin on the water, but they do recommend wearing water-friendly clothes as your feet and seat may get a bit wet. There will also be a safety boater on the water if you need any assistance (they’ll be in a red vest).

name: 43 Marvelous Things To Do In NYC In May 2025
description: As a new season approaches, NYC’s energy will soon be shifting intosummermode. But before we get there, let’s not forget thatMay is totally jam-packed with fun things to look forward to. That said, we’ve put together a giant list below of all themust-do activities happening this monthin the city. Let’s get into it: Cinco de Mayo(Monday, May 5th)commemorates Mexico’s victory against France in the 1862 Battle of Puebla, and the city’s Cinco de Mayo happenings are a way for Mexican-Americans to celebrate their cultural heritage and show off their pride. Find some of thebest ways to celebrate the holiday in NYC.

name: 26 Wonderful Things To Do On The Upper West Side, Manhattan
description: The Upper West Side is a quaint residential neighborhood in Manhattan, but its quintessential New York ambiance has been captured in shows and movies such asOnly Murders in the Building, Seinfeld,West Side Story,and more, where the brownstones and storefronts make for the perfect “rainy day in New York” footage, or add a perfect touch of mystery and romance. Take a trip up to the west side and venture amongst the famous sights and bites for yourself! Here are 26 things we recommend doing on The Upper West Side: Table Of Contents 5 Napkin Burger serves up premium, deluxeburgersoffered with toppings such as truffle, avocado ranch, buffalo chicken, and more. If you’re looking to elevate your burger experience, try out this burger joint, but not without tasting one of theirmilkshakes, which have the option of being boozed up. 📍 2315 Broadway Maison Pickle earned buzz on social media for its visually appealing food that makes your mouth instantly salivate.

userId: Source / Church of the Heavenly Rest
name: The Church Of The Heavenly Rest Is A Stunning Landmark On The Upper East Side
description: Designed by architect Hardie Phillip, thisGothic Deco buildingis located on the corner of Fifth Avenue and 90th Street. Thespacious interioris open-plan and allows visitors to admire the entire space from all angles. The Church of the Heavenly Rest also hosts Candlelight—the widely popularconcert seriesfeaturing tributes totimeless composers, contemporary artists, and more. If you have yet to behold this stunning landmark, then you can get there by taking the4, 5, or 6 subway linesto 86th Street station. You can also usebus linesnear Madison Avenue and 90th Street, and then walk to the church.

name: The Intrepid Is Hosting Free Outdoor Movie Nights On Top Of Its Enormous Aircraft Carrier
description: The Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum isn’tquitelike other museums in NYC. Instead of being in a historic building or a modern architectural feature, it’s aboard a legendary aircraft carrier that was in World War II, the Vietnam War and was used for space mission recovery! While it’s always cool to visit, they have some great events in the calendar — one of them being theirfree summer movie nightsatop the aircraft carrier’s massive flight deck with awesome views of the Hudson and skyline. To celebrate the ship’s new exhibitionApollo: When We Went to the Moon, all screened movies will be themed around the human interest and exploration of the moon. The series will kick off Memorial Day weekend kicked off on Friday, May 24th with doors opening at 7pm, allowing New Yorkers to watchTop Gun: Maverickright under the stars!

userId: Source / Jon Wallen & New-York Historical Society
name: 10 Best Kids Museums In NYC To Discover, Play, & Learn
description: With spring break right for the little ones around the corner, it’s time to start planning onwhat to do with your kids in NYC! Full ofinteractive exhibitsandhands-on activities, NYC is home to tons of children’s museums that are perfect for a day of adventure. To make planning a little easier, these are thebest kid-friendly museumsto open your kids up to a world of wonder and discovery! CMOM offers a wide range of exhibits and programs designed to engage children from infancy to age 12. The 40,000 square footUpper West Sidemuseum has exhibits like aNickelodeon-partnered Dora & Diego exhibit,immersive art installations and sculpturesthat lets little ones climb around(“Inside Art” exhibit), and even aseasonal splashy “Dynamic H2O” exhibitwhere they can learn about the importance of water and its role in NYC.

name: A Fabulous Spring Market Returns To Bryant Park This May
description: New Yorkers have grown to love Urbanspace’s public markets,be it the Vanderbilt, Lexington,West 52ndlocation, or our personal favorites, the pop-upholiday marketsat Union Square, Columbus Circle, andBryant Park. So get ready, because even though theWinter Village at Bryant Parkhas closed, anexcitingspring versionof the wildly popular shopping destination by Urbanspace titled “Makers Market” will return to Bryant Park once again this May. The seasonal market will focus on one-of-a-kind handmade items,featuring150 local vendorsoffering one-of-a-kind handmade items you can’t find in stores. Urbanspace is currently looking for vendorsto be a part of this creative community and is requiring applicants to “be local to New York (or the tri-state area) and feature products that are 100% designed by them and produced locally. ” Pop-up stalls will take over Bryant Parkover the course of four weekends in May.

name: 7 Best Flower Shows & Festivals In And Around NYC
description: Springis officially here and while we wait to ward off the rainy weather, we can’t help but think of the sunny warm days ahead! With that good weather comes flower blooms, and luckily they’ve already started blossoming all around New York City and its perimeters. To dowse you with some spring fever, we’ve put together a list ofamazing flower shows and festivalsthat you can check out in the coming weeks! We’re approaching the final week (closes April 22) ofThe Orchid Show: Florals in Fashion at theNew York Botanical Garden! The annual flower show brings the catwalk to the Enid A.

userId: Source / Flower Flashes by Lewis Miller Design / Old installation photo
name: A Stunning Sea Of Cherry Blossoms Will Beautify Brooklyn For Only One Day Tomorrow
description: After NYC’s gray winters we always look forward to the bloomingcherry blossom seasonto brighten up the city (and you can track where they’re blooming in Central Park specifically withthis interactive map)! Thoughtomorrow, Wednesday, April 17th,we’ll catch sight of a cherry blossom display never seen before. Tomorrow, theviral “Flower Flash” installationby floral designer Lewis Miller will pop up outside of the Brooklyn Museum for only one day. Flower Flash will create a stunning display of the world-famous Japanese cherry blossomson the steps of the Brooklyn Museum before opening hours(between 9:30 – 10:15 am). Cherry blossoms are especially beloved in Brooklyn,with some of the most dazzling bright pink blooms in the trees just outside the museum’s entrance and throughout the neighboring Brooklyn Botanic Gardens.

userId: Source / Felix Stahlberg,CC BY 2.0, via Wikimedia Commons
name: 15 Best Things To Do In Greenwich Village, NYC
description: It can be said that Greenwich Village isNew York City’s most cultural neighborhood, with history dating back to thecity’s 1960s counterculture movement, it being anentertainment hub in the city, and abirthplace for LGBTQ+ activism. Bounded by 14th Street to the north, Broadway to the east, Houston Street to the south, and the Hudson River to the west, it’s situated right in the heart of Downtown and is truly the heartbeat to Lower Manhattan. In this guide, we’re going to take you through some of ourfavorite things to do in Greenwich Village, includingrestaurants,bars, cool landmarks, and places to have a night out! The crown jewel of Greenwich Village isWashington Square Park, one of NYC’s instantly recognizableparksand plazas. The iconic park truly the heart of Greenwich Village, and features a central fountain, tree-lined pathways, and the iconic Washington Square Arch!

name: Here’s Where To Get Free Solar Eclipse Glasses In NYC
description: It’s now only a few days until thetotal solar eclipsewill cover New York skies in utter darkness! Though total solar eclipses are rarer than general solar eclipses, what makes this upcoming event absolutely unmissable is the fact that total solar eclipses only occur in the same placeevery 366 years, according toForbes. Still unsure what asolar eclipsemeans? According to theNational Weather Service, a solar eclipse occurs when the moon is sandwiched in passing between the sun and earth. The total solar eclipse happens when the moon completely blocks the sun’s light from earth, creating a shadow trail that is known as the path of totality.

name: These 10 Experiences In NYC Transport You Straight To The Roaring ‘20s
description: NYC had about 6 million residents back in the 1920s, standing tall as the central point for manufacturing and culture in the nation. With this economic boom camedelightful parties, extravagant gatherings and countless new buildings. Some of these buildings still exist today, and their old school appeal transports us to an important period in American history. Here are some of our favoritespots and activities in NYC that give off 1920s vibes, from bars to restaurants and of course — roaring ‘20s-themed parties. Originally a small gathering on Governor’s Island, the belovedJazz Age Lawn Partyis now one of the most sought after summer plans in NYC, and it’s returning for its 18th edition onJune 8th-9th and August 10th – 11th.

userId: Source / Photo Courtesy of: Jazz Age Brunch Parlour Room
name: Turn Up On The Weekends With An Unforgettable Jazz Brunch At These Two Stunning Restaurants
description: Get ready for a jam-packed weekend filled with dynamic tunes, delectable drinks and bountiful brunch! Pick between two stellar restaurants to dine at the Parlour Room on Saturdays and on Sundays head to Gotham for a Jazz Brunch by Michael Arenella & His Dreamland Orchestra! Be sure toget ticketswhile they’re available. For a limited time only, buy tickets to one of the summer’s biggest events, Jazz Age Lawn Party and get 50% off on an original Jazz Age Brunch Show by Michael Arenella & His Dreamland Orchestra in NYC! Tickets for this entertaining experienceinclude entry into the eventand your choice of acomplimentary cocktailor glass of wine.

name: We Went To Our First Sofar Sounds Concert In NYC, And It Was The Coziest Thing
description: Sofar Soundsteamed up withFeverto present a series ofexclusive concertsin neighborhoods across NYC, and we had the chance to attend the first concert of the series on March 29th! We weren’t quite sure what to expect since the lineup was kept under wraps, but it turned out to be asoothing eveningat the heart of Sofar Sounds offices in Chinatown. Keep reading for our review! Table Of Contents Securing the spots to our firstSofar concert, we couldn’t help but feel a bit apprehensive. Thankfully, the process was straightforward: we selected our concert and were informed we’d receive key details about the show a day before.

name: NYers Can Get Free Citi Bike Rides This April For Earth Day
description: This year we’ll celebrate Earth Day on Monday, April 22nd, and there’stons going on around the cityto encourage New Yorkers to be more environmentally conscious and to live in harmony with our planet! And this year Citi Bike is celebrating by offeringfree unlimited 30-minute rides to New Yorkers! The promotion is taking place in partnership with the Department of Transportation’s53-block Open Streets: Car-Free Earth Day event, which will take place between 10 am and 4 pm onSaturday, April 20th. Through the support of Lyft, Citi Bike will offer free unlimited 30-minute rides on a classic Citi Bike. All riders may take advantage of the offer by using thepromo code CARFREE24in the Citi Bike app.

name: 15 Best Things To Do In Brooklyn, New York
description: Right across the bridge from the bustling island of Manhattan sits Brooklyn, a diverse and eccentric borough home to tons of hip culture and things to do! Fromart under the Brooklyn Bridgetofine dining inWilliamsburg, Brooklyn is home to many hidden gems and attractions that make up the full NYC experience! To embark on the best tour throughout Kings County, these are the best things to do in Brooklyn, whether you’re visiting or simply a local! Among the “Concrete Jungle” lies some of the most beautiful greenery at the 52 acre Brooklyn Botanic Garden! The urban garden “connects people to the world of plants,” allowing visitors to get up close and personal with stunning florals.

userId: Source / Photo: Shutterstock / Sandra Meng - Soulndheart
name: 20 Delightful Things To Do In DUMBO, Brooklyn
description: Down Under Manhattan Bridge Overpass,admirably referred to as DUMBO, is one of the best neighborhoods to explore in Brooklyn. Over the years the area has grown from being filled with industrial warehouses to now being a vibrant area filled with delicious restaurants, heavenlycoffee shops, and unique shops. Plus, it boasts some of the most gorgeous views of the Manhattan skyline you can find. Here’s ourultimate guide to DUMBO, so you can see for yourself all the best that the neighborhood has to offer. Table Of Contents Did you know bees are responsible for about 1/4 of coffee production and 1/3 of all food?

name: 10 Electrifying Things To Do In Koreatown, Manhattan
description: The area from31st and 33rd Streets, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, is defined as Manhattan’s lively Koreatown (also referred to as K-Town). An influx of Korean immigrants moved to America between the 1970-1980s. It was around this time that Korean immigrants transformed this area of Manhattan to be a space for Korean community and local workers. Now, it’s often recognized for its bright signs, late night crowds and delicious offerings. Koreatown alone is jam-packed with more than 150 businesses!

name: NYC’s Late Night Museum Hours: A Night Owl’s Guide
description: New York City is the city that never sleeps, and with so many incrediblethings to do, it’s so hard to pack it all into one day! Especially ourmuseums, which definitely need multiple hours to properly admire. Luckily, iconic institutions like theMetropolitan Museum of Artto hidden gems like theRubinoffer extended hours, allowing visitors to immerse themselves in art, history, and culture long after the sun sets! Here’s our favorite museums with late night hours. Explore one of NYC’s most iconic art institutions by night when The Met goes“After Dark.

name: 10 Best Things To Do In The Bronx, New York
description: Packed to the brim with years of history and culture, The Bronx is one of NYC’s essential boroughs! It’s thebirthplace of hip-hop music, thehome of the largest largest metropolitan zoo in the country, and so many other attractions…there’s so much to discover in The Bronx! In this guide, we’ll help you decide on the best places to see and do in the area…which ranges from a slice of true NYC pizza in The Bronx’s Little Italy to catching a fly ball at Yankee Stadium. Check out our favorite places to visit in The Bronx below: The Bronx Zoo is theUnited States’ largest metropolitan zoo, and holdsover 6,000 animalsand tons of themed exhibits, animal feedings and demonstrations, and attractions like theJungleworld, Tiger Mountain, and the World of Birds. The zoo spans over 265 acres and additionally hostseducational programs, behind-the-scenes tours, and so much more.

name: You Can Now Pay To Let The Waterworks Flow In Your Own Private ‘Cry Room’ In NYC
description: If you’ve lived in NYC long enough, you know that there are times where yousimply just need to let out a substantial sob. And while literally no one would even bother to steal a second glance at the sight of you letting the waterworks flow, there are definitelybetter places to cry in NYCthan in public. So allow us to introduce Sob Parlour, NYC’s first pop-up‘cry spa’ that offers New Yorkers a refuge to have a full blown meltdown. The idea comes from founder Anthony Villiotti, who brought Sob Parlour to NYC in November of last year (2023). Acrossvarious locations in Manhattan–from office rental sites toart galleries–Villiotti invites those in need of a good cry to swing by and do exactly that.

name: There’s A Secret Treehouse Tucked Away In The Middle Of Manhattan
description: Whether you’re interested in reenacting a scene from High School Musical in Troy’s backyard, or you rather cozy up in a quiet place with a good book, this secret treehouse in the middle of Manhattan might just beNYC’s best hidden gemto date. Located within the depths of6BC Garden in theEast Villageis a tiny treehouse that’s entirely open to the public during garden hours. Upon entering the garden you’ll find the treehouse covered in twisting greenery past the beautiful walking trail. Once you climb up the stairs you’ll be privy toa calm sanctuary in the sky that overlooks the entire garden. You can choose to enjoy the indoor portion complete with bench seating under rows of bookshelves, or opt for the outside balcony table to breathe in the fresh air that can otherwise be hard to find in the city.

name: This Authentic Spanish Flamenco Tour Is Almost Here In NYC
description: Last year, NYC was lucky enough to get multiple installments of the very successfulAuthentic Flamenco world tour. The internationally-acclaimed production by Royal Opera of Madrid, one of the most notable artistic institutions in Spain. This year it’s returning but only for one day onJune 1st! Whiletickets are officially available. You can still get tickets to this remarkable show.

name: You Can Go Hiking With Llamas & Alpacas Only 2 Hours From NYC
description: With the weather getting nicer, it’s the perfect time toplan for a hike. So why notadd some furry friends to the mix? At Clover Brooke Farm in Hyde Park, NY — about a two-hour drive from NYC in the Hudson Valley of New York — you get toroam with your own llama or alpacaon a guided hike through pastures, paddocks, and past a bass pond! Thiswoman-ownedfarm was established in 2016 and is home tollamas, alpacas, sheep, dairy goats, “mini” Pygora goats,a fruit tree orchard, hop field, honey bee hives, and more — all across 25 beautiful acres. Thefarm itself actually dates back to the 1850swith restored stone walls, historic barns, and a 18th century farmhouse.

name: 16 Rave-Worthy Things To Do In Red Hook, Brooklyn
description: Though Red Hook is an often overlooked neighborhood in Brooklyn, it’s full of under-the-radar gems waiting to be explored. With waterfront spots everywhere you look and some of the best views of the Statue of Liberty, the trip to Red Hook is worth it merely for the gorgeous scenery. But beyond its aesthetics, lies an abundant selection of restaurants, bars and unique experiences to fill an entire day with. Here are 16 of the most rave-worthy things to in Red Hook, Brooklyn. Table Of Contents Opened in 2009, Red Hook Lobster Pound is a neighborhood staple adored by locals.

name: 10 Best Things To Do In Staten Island, New York
description: Although many people think of Staten Island as the“Forgotten Borough”we love it all the same, and in this guide we’ve put together a list of the best things to do in the area! Worth the mighty journey across the New York Harbor, there’s plenty ofparksand museums worth a visit…or even a little day trip! Without further ado, here are thebest things to do in Staten Island, NYC right now! Our first recommendation of things to do in Staten Island is getting there in the first place via theStaten Island Ferry! Hop aboard thisfreetransportationand make your way over to the borough from Manhattan…passing stunning views of theStatue of Libertyand Ellis Island along the way of course!

name: A New 6-Day Music Festival Makes Its Governors Island Debut This Summer
description: As thefirst 7pm sunset of the yearinches closer and the days slowly (but surely) get longer, all we can think about is one thing–the nicer weather. And thisbrand new music festivalis stealing some sunshine fromour friends over in Miamiand bringing it to NYC! Founded in 2022, theadult-oriented music festival, dubbed We Belong Here,pitched themselves as a festival for those who had outgrown the current festival and club scene, and this summer they’re bringing a stacked lineup of performers to NYC’s Governor’s Island for the first time. Spread out across two weekends,festival goers can indulge in amazing lineups curated by talented DJs andlive performancesalong with premium curated experiences. Thelineup will includesets by Le Youth, Simon Doty, Bakermat, Korolova, and Nora Van Elken, just to name a few.

name: This Whimsical Japanese Stationery & Gift Shop Is A Cat Lover’s Dream
description: From itspickle bookstoreto itsfully pink bubble tea shop, NYClovesatheme–andthis quirky gem is no exception! Nestled on 10th Street in theEast Villageyou’ll findNiconeco Zakkaya–a shop offering the cutest stationery and gifts you could ever imagine…particularly if you’re a feline fanatic! Throughout the space you’ll find everything fromnotebooks and stationery to ceramics and cute posters,but woven throughout it all is one common theme–cats! Owner Siming first opened Niconeco Zakkaya’sinaugural brick-and-mortar shop in 2019. Before then, the brand was operating as an Etsy shop for four years.

name: Sofar Sounds Brings Intimate Live Music To Unexpected NYC Spaces
description: If you’ve ever been to a concert, then you understand the frustration of being in a noisy, smelly & ecstatic crowd. And sure, depending on the artist performing, it might be worth it (hey, Beyoncé! ) — but in general, being pushed and shoved in a huge arena might not make it to our top 5 life moments. EnterSofar Sounds, a company that organizessmall-scale concertsthat bring artists and audiences together throughlive musicin the most unique of places. The gag is, you won’t know who you’ll be seeing on stage — until the day before the concert.

name: This Under The Radar, Black-Owned Business Is NYC’s First-Ever Vinyl Record Craft Beer Bar
description: Upon envisioning the bar’s creation, ownerChris Maestrohad discovered that a similar concept had already existed in Japan called jazu kissa (jazz cafes), according toBlackownedbklyn. Maestro knew that this type of space was needed in NYC and went on to establish his very own shop in 2017—being the first vinyl record craft beer bar across the boroughs! The establishment has over 5,000 vinyl records on-site, ranging from hip-hop, funk, soul, and jazz. On top of its wide music collection, the bar offers an extensive yet carefully curated tap list with a large portion of its beers sourced from local breweries found in North Fork, LI, or in upstate New York. The warm and inviting space is lined with records and decorated with wooden benches, couches, and even has a beautiful backyard to enjoy!

name: Watermark’s Chromatic Pink Wonderland Is Open At Pier 15 For A Limited Time
description: An entirelypink piersounds like the stuff of dreams, and yet, you’ll get to experiencea monochromatic wonderlandfilled with rose-colored everything. Trees, glasshouses, cocktails and even food… everything turns pink at Pier 15, much to the delight of pink lovers everywhere. Grab your loved ones and secure your spot for thisheart-warming experienceat the heart of NYC! 📢Don’t miss out on the love — the experience ends on March 31st! 🎀 After the delightfulSanta’s Winter Wonderland, Watermark debuted its Pink Pier!

name: 15 Best Solo Dates To Take Yourself On In NYC
description: NYC can be the most romantic place on the planet whether you’re with someone or alone! So treat yourself to the solo dates you deserve and take full advantage of this incredible city while you get to know yourself a little better. You might just love what you find! Here are15 best solo datesto take yourself on in NYC: Start your day on atram ride over the East Riverand take in all the stunning skyline sights from above. Once you get to the island, be sure to stroll along the west promenade.

name: 15 Best Chelsea Art Galleries To Check Out Right Now
description: This history started as far back as 1884, when the iconic Hotel Chelsea opened on 23rd Street and became a haven for the NYC art and music scene (Andy Warhol even made a film there! ). Today, it still holds that same cultural significance, with the addition of the elevated High Line Park with its outdoor exhibitions, and of course, the many art galleries—which are allfreeto visit. So here’s a guide for your next budget-friendly, high-culture outing with some ofthe best free art galleries in Chelsea, NYC: Larry Gagosian is a renowned art gallery owner who started off in Los Angeles in 1980 and has since expanded to New York (his second oldest gallery), Los Angeles, San Francisco, London, Paris, Geneva, Basel, Rome, Athens and Hong Kong. It’s a bit high-end, but arguably one of the most best galleries in all of the city, closer to a museum in and of itself.

name: 40 Exhilarating Things To Do In The East Village
description: NYC’s East Village neighborhood has some of the most vibrant spots in the entire city. There’s never a dull moment in the area, you just need to know where to look! Here’s our ultimate guide on the East Village, so you can experience all the best that the neighborhood has to offer. Table Of Contents This East Village staple offers a 3-for-1 drinks special on weekends that pairs perfectly with their mouthwatering brunch menu, including choices like griddle cakes, omelettes and more. Note: Lil’ Frankie’s is cash only.

name: 30 Sensational Things To Do In SoHo, NYC
description: Table Of Contents The gorgeous neighborhood is defined by its picturesque architecture, celebrity sightings and restaurant staples. With so much to explore it’s hard to know how to narrow it all down. That’s why we’ve created the ultimate guide on SoHo, so you can experience all the best that the neighborhood has to offer. Situated [so]uth of [Ho]uston Street, sits one of NYC most popular neighborhoods with tons of things do! From the endless amount of shops to galleries and immersive experiences, here’s what to do in SoHo!

name: The Largest Indoor Water Park In New York Is Open Year-Round
description: The Kartrite Resort & Indoor Waterpark, located in in Monticello, NY (only 90 minutes outside of NYC) first opened to the public back in 2019 as the largest indoorwater parkin New York State, and year-round they offertwo-acres-worth of endless fun. The water park is complete withseveral water rides and slides,a lazy river, a rope bridge across the water, and more than 100 water adventures including a massive dump bucket. As their website describes it, the space is “covered entirely by the world’s largest texlon transparent roof, soit’s 84 degrees of summer perfection – all year long. Don’t forget the sunscreen (even in the middle of winter). It’s the ideal Catskills waterpark adventure.

name: 5 Best Places To Go Axe Throwing In NYC
description: With the world’s most bustling nightlife filled with places to go and people to see, you’ll never run out of thrillingthings to do in NYC! But have you every tried axe throwing? It’s one of our favorite heart-racing hobbies that’s perfect for adate night,team bonding experience, or a way to switch up a night out! So what do you say, you up for some healthy competition? We gathered up our favorite spots to go axe throwing in NYC, check them out!

name: 10 Exciting Classes In NYC To Take in 2024
description: It’s a new year, and if you’re anything like us, you plan on being your best self in 2024. While there are millions of things to do in NYC year round, there are so many things to learn! If you addedmastering a new skillto your resolution list, we’ve got you covered. There is no shortage ofclasses and workshopsin the Big Apple to get your creative juices flowing. Whether you want to learn to make candles, create pottery, make pasta from scratch, or even learn to DJ, the possibilities are endless!

name: A New Playground With Larger-Than-Life Climbable Fish Has Opened In Hudson River Park
description: Manhattan’s Pier 26 is now officially home to a brand new4,000-square-foot marine-science-focused playgroundthat gives kids the chance to both have fun and learn at the same time. The Hudson River Park Trust first broke ground on the new playground in December 2022, and the Pier 26 Science Play Area is nowHudson River Park’s fifth children’s play area. Designed by award-winning firm OLIN and managed by Gilbane Building Company, the playground isentirely science-focused, offering kids a space to not only play but also be inspired by and learn about marine wildlife and the Hudson River Habitat. Children can climb insideinteractive sculptural elements–such as play structures shaped as the two endangered sturgeon species that are native to the Hudson River–and explore fish “anatomy” while interacting with other marine-oriented play features. Trees, plants, climbing nets, and various other engaging play featureshave also been planted and installed throughout the park.

name: Raise A Glass & A Bouquet At This Interactive Flower Arranging Workshop
description: Valentine’s Dayis coming up, but it’s always a good day for flowers! While we know manyflower shops to order fromand plenty oftalented florists in NYC, why not learn how toarrange flowers yourself? ! If you’re tired of boring arrangements of roses and baby’s breath, have no fear — Read My Tulips NYC’s monthlyBlooms & Booze Floral Arranging Workshopis here to teach you a new hobby you never knew you needed. And did we mention the experience isopen bar?

name: A Complete Guide To Celebrating Kwanzaa 2023 In NYC
description: Holiday season is in full swing, and while you’re finishing up the last things on yourholiday bucket list, it’s important we highlight Kwanzaa and how NYC is celebrating this year! Particularly in Harlem and other Caribbean neighborhoods around the city, we’ve put together a guide about the holiday and what’s going on around NYC! Kwanzaa is a an annual holiday that celebrates African-American culture, unity, and heritage. Devised in 1966, this holiday honors African social values and typically consists of large feasts, gatherings, gift exchanging, and more! Kwanzaa this year begins on on December 26 and goes until January 1, 2024.

name: This Over-The-Top 3-Floor Christmas Bar Has Reopened In NYC
description: Frosty’s is bringing some serious holiday nostalgia to life through life-sized toy soldiers, glistening garland, eye-catching ribbon and wreaths, and the best holiday tunes spinning until 4a. m. at their multi-levelChristmas bar popping upin Midtown. The halls are deckedacross three floors, comprised of a bar, restaurant, and a speakeasy, providing visitors with an endless amount of holiday fun. Head to the wrapping paper-covered bar to order signature North Pole cocktails such as theBaby, it’s Cold Outside Martiniand theVery Merry Punch.

name: This Magnificent Miniature Art Museum ‘Small Is Beautiful’ Is Ending Soon In NYC
description: The depth and creativity of Small Is Beautiful has been making big waves in New York at718 Broadwaybut it’s closing it’s doors on Dec. 31st! Get tickets while you canto this thoughtfully tiny spectacle, a museum featuring over 30 international artists and130 pieces of art. For any art lover, this experience is a great gift to give during December! Small but mighty, this artistic adventure is here until the end of December!

name: You Can Now Explore This Mysterious NYC Island For The First Time Ever
description: NYC is home to many surrounding islands—hell, Manhattan itself is one. And though we’re sure you’ve heard ofLong Island,Governors Island, even Roosevelt Island, are you familiar with Hart Island? This mysterious island located in the northeastern Bronx (adjacent toCity Island) was purchased by the Department of Charities and Correction in 1868. It was intended to be a workhouse for older boys from Randall’s Island’s House of Refuge. By 1869, the workhouse had opened and soon, the island became amass burial ground for unclaimed and unidentified bodies.

name: Lotte New York Palace Is The Most Magical Place To Be This Holiday Season
description: In the heart of our vibrant city is the timeless and iconic hotel known asLotte New York Palace– or simply,The Palaceto Gossip Girl fans. This unofficial landmark hotel has been the subject of much anticipation and excitement, but it all goes up a notch during the holiday season. After years of meticulous restoration work on the historic Villard Mansion, the hotel is set to usher in theholiday seasonwith a touch ofenchantment and grandeur. The news of the return of themagnificent courtyardChristmas tree, a beloved symbol of festive cheer and wonder, has set the city abuzz. This year, Lotte New York Palace is pulling out all the stops to make the holiday season an unforgettable experience for guests and visitors alike.

name: Take A Guided Visit To The Hidden Ghost Station In NYC’s Subway System
description: Our century-old subway system (and the world’s largest! ) is a quintessential part of NYC, and members of the New York Transit Museum will get exclusive access to explore it in all of its glory. Returning to the museum aretours of the old City Hall subway station, the first-ever station of the New York City subway. Opened in 1904, it was intended to be the pièce de résistance of the entire transit system. The tour begins above ground to discuss Alfred Beach’s Pneumatic Tube, beforetraveling deep underground to uncover all the secrets and fascinating history of our transit system and beyond.

name: The Pepsi 125 Diner Has Opened Its Doors In SoHo
description: After much anticipation,The Pepsi 125 Dinerhas finally opened its doors in SoHo! The pop-up experience, produced by Fever, that has arrived in NYCcelebrates 125 years of Pepsi, offering guests a chance to immerse themselves in the beloved soda brand’s past, present, andfuture. Althoughtickets for The Pepsi 125 Dinerarenearly sold out, we’re giving you aninside lookinto the spectacular immersive event. Read on for our full review of The Pepsi 125 Diner! When you enter The Pepsi 125 Diner, the fun kicks off with an interactive taste test:the Pepsi Challenge.

name: These Are The Best Movies In Theaters Right Now — And You Can Watch Them At Nearly Half Price!
description: Remember when a night at the movies meant waving goodbye to a hefty chunk of your paycheck? —$20 a ticket, in this economy? We don’t think so! — Well, hold onto your popcorn because now you canwatch all of the best blockbuster movies in NYC at nearly half their box office price– and no, this is not a scam! Thanks to anexclusive Fever offer, you can now enjoy all your favorite movies atAMC TheatresandRegal Cinemaswith an unbeatable price that will make going to the movies a weekly habit.

name: Indulge In The Ultimate Beauty Experience At SEPHORiA This Weekend
description: Calling all beauty enthusiasts! SEPHORiAreturns for its fifth consecutive year, and it’s set to make a splash inNew York Citynext week! This annual beauty extravaganza, hosted bySephora, is guaranteed toawaken your inner beauty guruand prepare you to slay the season. Whether you’re obsessed withmakeup,skincare,haircare, or all things beauty-related, this event is an absolute must-attend – we promise! SEPHORiA is THE place to rub elbows with yourfavorite beauty icons, discover thelatest products, snagincredible swag, and much more.

name: The Continental Hotel Bar Is A Can’t-Miss Cocktail Experience With A Killer Twist
description: Last week, we visited the world’s most dangerously exclusive hotel forWelcome to The Continental: The Hotel Bar Experience. This incredible fully-immersive event was based on Peacock’s epic, three-part seriesThe Continental: From the World of John Wick. The event gave guests a chance to step back in time to the 1970s setting of thehighly-anticipated new showand to explore the sexy, chic mainstay of theJohn Wickuniversefor an unforgettable evening ofdecadent cocktailsandlive, interactive storylinesthroughout the space. Our visit toThe Continentalstarredclassic cocktails with a killer twistat theinfamous hotel bar. But before we could get too comfortable, we were roped into aninteractive, high-stakes missionto help uphold the hotel’s one cardinal rule: no bloodshed on the hotel premises… The experience was a dive deep into the inner workings of 1970s NYC’s criminal underworld with plots, secret messages, anddeceptive charactersto contend with over the course of the evening.

name: There’s Limited Time To Drink At This Hidden 19th Century Chapel Bar Tucked Away Inside This Phenomenal Photography Museum
description: Tickets are available for a limited timeto enjoy the stunningChapel Barand theNew York branch of Swedish photography museum Fotografiska. But there are only a a few dates left to sip on decadent drinks at this dark and moody 19th centurychapel! The swanky lounge used to be exclusive to members of Fotografiska, but now it’s open to the public! Your tickets will get you into the museum and in the bar afterward. Chapel Bar is open on Tuesday through Saturdays from 6pm until late.

name: An Immersive Pop-Up Pepsi Diner Experience Is Coming To Midtown NYC
description: On September 5, tickets will go on sale for The Pepsi 125 Diner, an amazing,immersive Pepsi dinerwhere everything is themed around the iconic American soda we all know and love. Fromphoto momentsandtableside entertainmentto a uniquePepsi food menu– you don’t want to miss this one-off event. Thepop-up restaurant experiencewill open its doors at a venue inMidtown NYC on October 19forone week only. It’s all in celebration of the 125th birthday of Pepsi, and diner guests will have the opportunity to relive some of themost famous Pepsi momentsof the last 125 years through the lens of music and pop culture. There will be anexhibition of one-of-a-kind Pepsi memorabiliawithcool photo ops, vintage commercials, music, and interactive elements to explore.

name: 8 Best Pool Halls In NYC To Play Billiards Right Now
description: In the heart of NYC’s competitive nature comes yet another fun way to go head to head with friends or family. Matching the energetic energy of the city, its pool halls give both billiards enthusiasts and casual players a chance to enjoy the timeless game. From trendy urban venues to classic neighborhood joints, these are the best pool halls in NYC forfirst dates,group outings, or a casual night out with friends! Located right in the heart of East Village/Union Square, Amsterdam Billiards Club is NYC’s original upscale billiard club. They offer25 Brunswick pool tables, ping pong tables, darts, foosball and beer pongtoo.

userId: Source / Facebook / The Great Jack O'Lantern Blaze
name: The Great Jack O’Lantern Blaze Will Return As The Largest Fall Spectacle, With Two Locations In NY
description: Even though it’s still summer, we’re thinking about the upcoming fall weather and there’s no better way to celebratethan with one of the most popular events of the Halloween season. Tickets are already on salefor the fun Great Jack O’Lantern Blaze! Enjoy the return of this pumpkin palooza in two locations in NY! You have your choice oftwo locations to visit in New York! You can check out the experience inHudson Valleyat Van Cortlandt Manor Croton-on-Hudson fromSeptember 15th through November 19th.

name: 22 Lively Things To Do On The Lower East Side, Manhattan
description: If you find yourself on theLower East Sideof Manhattan but you’re unsure what to do, know that you are in one of the most happening and historical neighborhoods of the city. From countless immigrant stories that all began on the Lower East Side, to iconic locations and establishments that have been captured in some of the most famous movies in existence, the Lower East Side is anything but boring. So whether you’re interested in eating, exploring, or learning something new,here are our favorite recommendations for all of the best things to do on Manhattan’s Lower East Side. Table Of Contents One of NYC’s top dining attractions is Katz’s Deli on the Lower East Side. Stop in for their famouspastrami on rye—but be prepared for a line!

name: This Boutique Brooklyn Bookstore Solely Sells Romance Novels
description: If you’re a sucker for romance and a bit of a bookworm, your wildest fantasy has just opened up in Brooklyn:a bookstore entirely devoted to romance novels. CalledThe Ripped Bodice, this independent, queer and women-ownedbookstoreoriginally started in Los Angeles in 2016. Owners and sisters Leah and Bea Koch have been lifelong romance readers. They had a dream to open a romance-only bookstore, and after a successful Kickstarter campaign, were able to make that dream a reality. Seven years after being founded, the duo has opened a brand new location in Park Slope, Brooklyn.

userId: Source / Photo courtesy of Wonderland Dreams via @mike_moanghan
name: This 26,000 Square-Foot Exhibit Of Alice’s Adventures In Wonderland Is Closing Soon
description: Take yourself on a mesmerizing journey through the looking glass atWonderland Dreams, an interactive art experience and bar in Midtown! But act fast, as the hand-painted exhibit won’t be in town for much longer! Created by artist Alexa Meade, this26,000-square-foot immersive dreamscapeis inspired by the magic of Lewis Carroll’sAlice’s Adventures in Wonderland. 20 rooms of floor to ceiling paintingstransport visitors to a world of giant playing cards, secret rose gardens, and mad tea parties, and puts theminsidethe paintings themselves in a living gallery. Every inch of the space is hand-painted usingMeade’s signature 3D painting stylewhich makes the world appear to be a 2D work of art.

name: The Stunning Williamsburg Hotel Is Taking Events In NYC To New And Exciting Heights
description: Situated in a hipBrooklyn neighborhood,The Williamsburg Hotelis aluxury refugefrom the hustle and bustle of the city. Thiseight-story giantis one of the many towering figures that make up the iconic NYC skyline, so it’s no surprise that it also offersenviable 360 viewsof the city. Visitors can go up to the hotel’s unconventional Water Tower Bar and snazzy rooftop pool and take in thesebreathtaking vistaswith a cocktail or two. What’s more, alongside housing visitors on their stay in the city, this magnificent hotel also hosts multiple events throughout the year including themagical Candlelight concert series. The hotel is right in the middle of all the action, and it’s reallywell-connectedin terms of transport.

userId: Source / Photo of Singapore via Shutterstock/ Stockbym
name: A Vibrant Singaporean Food Festival Has Arrived In NYC
description: Immerse yourself in the vibrant flavors of Singapore at this year’sSingapore Food Festival. Happening from now throughSeptember 15th, participatingSingaporeanandSingaporean-owned restaurants and bars across North America are working withSingapore Tourism Board AmericasandSingaporeGlobal Network to launch adigital food passportthat couldland you a free trip to the island! Upon visiting one of theparticipating restaurants, be sure to scan the on-site QR code that will take you to the Passport landing page. From there, diners will be able to enter for the chance to be the lucky winner of a trip to the Lion City. The winner will get a 4-day/3-night trip to Singapore with a travel companion of their choice.

name: NYC’s First Trans-Owned Queer Boxing Gym Makes Its Home In Williamsburg
description: NYC is home to plenty ofgyms, fromboxing gymstorock climbing gyms, butOutBox is NYC’s only trans-owned queer boxing gym. OutBox is the brainchild offounder and head coach Max Adler, USA amateur boxer, coach, and personal trainer with over decade of experience. After years of competing in the female division, Max transitioned and re-entered the fighting world, where hardships he experienced as a trans person in sports and fitness inspired him to create a space where Trans/GNC/LGBTQ+members of the community could come train and workout comfortably. On the schedule you’ll find boxingclasses for all levels, including All-Levels Boxing & Strength, Intermediate Boxing, and their Advanced Sparring Class. They also offerLGBTQ+ classes and private training, including personal training and TGNC training, which are always Queer-led and suitable for all levels of experience.

name: Top 5 Reasons You Have To Check Out This Stunning Small Is Beautiful Art Museum
description: The captivating experience that isSmall Is Beautifulhas been leaving a big imprint on the hearts of art fans globally,over 150,000 guestsworldwide to be exact! The museum is currently running and is located on718 Broadway in Manhattan. There are many pieces of art on display and so much to see. Some of the art is so intricate and tiny so pay close attention so you don’t miss it. The experience has been highly revered since it opened in NYC (4.

name: 18 Fabulous Things To Do In Flushing, Queens
description: Table Of Contents Queens’ Flushing neighborhood is aconstantly evolving and diverse area. Home to one of NYC’s Chinatowns, this vibrant neighborhood has a different feel than other Queens neighborhoods. It was even frequently visited byAnthony Bourdain, so youknowit’s a must-visit. From the best places to grab a bite to eat to an insider’s look at the neighborhood’s best museums and parks,here’s our ultimate guide to Flushing, Queens. No morning is complete without a nice, strong cup of joe–that’s why we’re thankful that New York City has no shortage of absolutely amazingcoffee shops!

name: 7 Best Helicopter Tours In NYC You Must Experience Now
description: Prepare to see the Big Apple like never before! New York City’s iconic skyline is of course gorgeous, but what about when it’s viewed from thousands of feet in the air? Whether you’re visiting from out of town or want to see your city from a bird’s eye view, helicopter tours are so worth it. With some departing from Manhattan and others nearby in New Jersey, it’s an exhilerating experience you need to do at least once! Here’s our favorite helicopter tours of NYC you should book now.

name: 18 Trendy NYC Bars Where You Can Dance Under A Dazzling Disco Ball
description: Whether it’s the long-awaited weekend or a simple weekday, an endless night of dancing always sounds like a good time! So live out your Saturday Night Fever fantasies at these trendy NYC bars where you can dance under a dazzling disco ball. Get groovy beneath Hotel 50 Bowery at Daphne, Gerber Group’s newest venture. This intoxicating disco club is an ode to the 70s, but with a 21st century twist! Dance to spinning DJs every weekend under dazzling disco balls that wash the entire space in a beautiful light.

name: View Over 30 NYC Galleries For Free This Week During The Chelsea Gallery Walk
description: Before the city’s galleries close for their annual summer breaks, there’s still time to immerse yourself in art and culture at some of the best that Chelsea galleries have to offer! The Art Dealers Association of America (ADAA) is hosting thefifth iteration of its annualChelsea Gallery Walkthis month, on Wednesday, July 19th. As part of this free, self-guided walk,galleries participating in the event will stay open late(until 8 p. m. ) for a rare opportunity for New Yorkers to get a glance at their exhibitions after-hours.

name: You Can Explore Catacombs By Candlelight Beneath This Historic Cathedral
description: Deep below New York City’s bustling streets, historic catacombs within the Basilica of St. Patrick’s Old Cathedral await your exploration. Through an exclusive tour, visitors will gain access to parts of the church that areotherwise off-limits to visitors. The historic space, located in Nolita at 266 Mulberry Street, is over 200 years old and has played a major role in NYC history. And now, you canget a unique behind-the-scenes tour of the famous cathedral.

name: This NYC Comedy Club Is Serving Up Endless Laughs And Plenty Of Cocktails
description: St. Mark’s Comedy Club, a popularspeakeasy performance venue, is taking the East Village by storm! Aptly named after its location on the city’s iconic St. Marks Place, the comedy club is hosting evening shows and open mic nights all summer long. From rising stars to national headliners, you won’t want to miss out on these truly hilarious acts.

name: Get Down(ward Dog) With Adorable Puppies At This Dog-Friendly Yoga Studio
description: Puppysphere is a pawsitively perfect spot for yogis and dog lovers alike and a new location has just opened in Manhattan! Originally based in Toronto and Brooklyn, Puppysphere has been open since September 2021 and is still one of the most adorable yoga experiences in existence. The new SoHo studio offers75-minute classes. Start with 45 minutes of Flow Yoga as playful pups jaunt all around the studio. After getting your workout in, you’ll be rewarded with 30 minutes of purepuppy cuddles and bottomless mimosas—what’s better than that?

name: Brave Enough To Explore The Catacombs Of Old St. Patrick’s Cathedral By Candlelight?
description: Head to Old St. Patrick’s Cathedral in Nolita foraone-of-a-kind tour of its historic catacombs, an experience every local (and tourist) should check out. This underground space used to be sealed off from the public, but those brave enough can now explore it by candlelight. The Basilica of Saint Patrick’s Old Cathedral (or Old St. Patrick’s), located at266 Mulberry Streetbetween Prince and Houston Streets in Nolita, is a little over 200 years old and has seen plenty during that time.

name: See Yayoi Kusama’s All New Infinity Mirrored Room In NYC For Free
description: If at first the name doesn’t ring a bell, remember thatinsanely life-like womenin the window of Louis Vuitton’s flagship on Fifth Avenue? Or the one whodecorates the side of the store’s 12-story facade? Yes, Yayoi Kusama has been taking over NYC (and the world) for years. Her signature dotted pattern and her Instagrammable infinity mirror rooms have made her work quite recognizable. New Yorkers will once again have the opportunity to experience her masterful art this spring at David Zwirner.

name: Artist Alexa Meade Has Turned The 79th Floor Of The World Trade Center Into Her Studio
description: Alexa Meade has officially secured the best studio spot in NYC! This spring, Meade announced that she is the newArtist in Residence at the World Trade Center. With 80 stories of floor-to-ceiling windows, 3 World Trade Center offers up incredible lighting and stunning views – truly an artist’s dream location! And with her studio on the 79th floor, Meade has one of the most coveted spots in the building. Recognized by many from herhand-painted immersive art exhibitnear Bryant Park, Meade can turn anything into a canvas by painting directly onto the human body and three-dimensional spaces.

userId: Source / The Oasis Dance Floor. Courtesy Lincoln Center.
name: Lincoln Center’s ‘Summer For The City’ Fest Has Officially Returned With Silent Discos, An Outdoor Cinema, & More
description: NYC’s ultimate festivalSummer for the Cityis officially returning this summer for its second year! Over the course ofthree months, Lincoln Center will turn into the ultimate go-to spot for summer fun, featuring hundreds of free events, thousands of artists, and food from across the city for New Yorkers to browse and enjoy. “We are blessed to be in the heart of the most diverse city in the world, and to have sixteen acres of outdoor space to celebrate the magic of this bustling global city,”said Shanta Thake, Ehrenkranz Chief Artistic Officer of LCPA. “Over three months, we welcome all New Yorkers to come dance, love, and celebrate together with long-standing traditions…and new traditions. ” This year Lincoln Center’s full campus will undergo atotal transformationin partnership with visionary artist Clint Ramos, who will incorporate playful designs throughout the space–think: an installation containing 200 flamingos and a 10-foot disco ball–creating multiple outdoor spaces for New Yorkers to come together and celebrate the city’s vibrant community.

name: The Fun Flops Of The Museum Of Failure Is Leaving Brooklyn In June
description: Ever wondered what happened to fat free Pringles, Coke II…or beef lasagna Colgate? Yeah, we don’t either. If you are curious,the Museum of Failure is closing on June 18thbut tickets are still available. This fun and insightful exhibit brings together over 150 products and services that were a total flop. Even though these inventions might have failed it also paved the way for other great inventions.

name: 10 Best Places To Watch Cabaret In NYC Right Now
description: If you’re looking for an up close and personal kind of a night out, consider cabaret! These intimate concerts and performances inside nightclubs and dimly lit venues are a great alternative to a night out, and can feature some of the best acts around. Especially here in NYC, where everything seems to be over the top, we’ve got some places that are constantly…flaunting it! Check out our favorite spots for cabaret below and see what’s coming up in their event spaces! This cabaret show takes place in a hidden speakeasy in Midtown, and that’s barely where the dark intimacy begins.

name: 12 Gorgeous Scenic Drives To Take Around New York This Spring
description: New York State is known for its magnificent scenery. Fromcharming townsto spectacular mountains and waterways, simply driving down one of New York’s most beautiful byways can be a vacation in itself. So if you find yourself needing a little respite from the city and craving some of the most stunning sights offered in the state, we’ve got just the list for you: New York’s most scenic routes and drives. Rev up those engines and don’t forget your camera because you’ll want to take in everything you’ll pass. Here are the most scenic drives around New York.

name: Cool Off And Unwind With Boozy Ice Pops At This New Rooftop Pool In NoMad
description: Nothing beats a day on an NYCrooftop during the Spring/Summermonths in NYC. A nice drink to cool you off withthe city as your backdropis truly unmatched. But if you want to switch it up a bit, throw arooftop poolinto the mix! There are a few around the city, but this new one hasa view like no other. IntroducingThe Pool Clubat the newly openedVirgin Hotels New York City!

name: These Outdoor Reading Rooms At The Brooklyn Library Are The Perfect Place To Curl Up On A Sunny Day
description: NYC has becomethecity ofoutdoor dining, and there are lots of other creative uses of outdoor space to take advantage of the beautiful weather. One example we’ve been loving is the fresh“outdoor reading rooms”at the Brooklyn Library’s Central Library in Prospect Heights (10 Grand Army Plaza). The outdoor reading rooms came about during the pandemic, when the Brooklyn Public Library told us they were working tirelessly to make sure they were still able to connect with patrons who rely on them for books and other resources. “We are always thinking: if we cannot have patrons come into the library, how can we bring our services out to them? ”a spokesperson said.

userId: Source / Photo Courtesy of Museum of Digital Experiences
name: New York City’s First All Digital Museum Is Open In Brooklyn
description: TheMuseum of Digital Experienceshas a variety of installations that guests can enjoy and interact with. The exhibit is open in Brooklyn and tickets are on sale! Use the code SPRINGINTHEMODE for 15% off of admission tickets. The experience puts artists of the future at the forefront and showcasesunique digital installations. Some elements of the museum work with your movement and reflection which is sure to make for some fun and memorable moments.

name: NYC’s Pier 57 To Host A Slew Of Free Springtime Programs & Events
description: Get ready for some fun at NYC’s Pier 57 as they recently announced they’llhost a wide range offunprogramming beginning this spring. Though the full calendar of events has not yet been revealed (it comes out at the end of this month), visitors can expectfree, family-friendly program and eventsthat are both fun and educational. The events will take place in Pier 57’scommunity classrooms, which are designed to promote gathering, dialogue, and learning. The lineup includes: Children’s Museum of the Arts The Coding Space Counseling in Schools MoMath Smartworks Street Lab “Pier 57 has created welcoming, community-focused spaces where the public can relax, learn, eat and enjoy–our goal from the start when we began planning to revitalize the pier,”saidNoreen Doyle, President & CEO, Hudson River Park Trust. “The diverse spaces and programs including Hudson River Park’s own environmental Discovery Tank will serve park-goers of all ages in state-of-the-art facilities housed within a historic pier, all within one of the largest waterfront parks in New York City.

name: The Largest Indoor Water Park In North America Is Only 45 Min. From NYC
description: At three million square feet, the mammoth “mega-mall” is the epitome of excessiveness…and was thus dubbed, “The American Dream. ” While the massive space is not in NYC directly, it’s pretty darn close! The American Dream in New Jersey’s Meadowlands boasts anindoor ski slope, Nickelodeon Theme Park,professional-sized ice skating rink, blacklight mini golf course, and perhaps itspièce de résistance:a humongous indoor water park! So big, in fact, that it’s actual thelargest one in all of North America. And it’s the perfect winter escape from the cold city weather.

name: 23 Delicious Things To Eat In Little Italy, The Bronx
description: Did you know there’s another Little Italy in New York City that’s way further uptown? Okay, it’s in another borough completely! Arthur Avenue (or the area of Belmont) in the Bronx, is also known as “Little Italy in the Bronx. ” This area has developed a very special, under-the-radar alcove of quality Italian restaurants, markets, bakeries, and shops thanks to the generations of Italian immigrants who have lived there. Here are some of our favorite spots in the neighborhood!

userId: Source / KIND Secret Farmer's Market circa 2022
name: There’s A Secret Farmer’s Market Popping Up Behind A Refrigerator Door In Chelsea
description: Didn’t get around to do your grocery shopping this weekend? Don’t stress, there’s a way you can get it all done and without spending a dime! Yes, you read that right. From February 28th through March 1, KIND is bringing back their secret farmer’s market, whereeverything is entirely free of charge. However, instead of beingdisguised behind a vending machine, this year’s secret farmer’s market is hidden behind a refrigerator door in Chelsea Market.

name: Escape To A Snowy Winter Wonderland At Loreley Beer Garden
description: Loreley Beer Garden’s Snowy Winter Wonderland pop-upinitially opened on January 11, transforming the space into the ultimate snowy, winter destination. Theirtwo outdoor heated spaces(the main garden out back and the street side dining area in the front) have transformed for the winter with snowy branches, faux fur accents, white florals, garlands, and more, creating a cozy winterscape right in the heart of NYC. Fill up on hearty, warmingGerman-inspired disheslike grilled Sausage Party platters, schnitzels, cheesy spaetzle with bacon, and giant pretzels to dip in warm beer cheese. But let’s get to the real stars of the show—theirfestive winter cocktails! Loreley Beer Garden is known for their over-the-top, insta-worthy drinks overflowing with whipped cream, frothy tops, and warm seasonal spices.

name: This New Studio In Brooklyn Is Where Tattoos And Self-Care Meet
description: When you think about yourlocal go-to tattoo parlor, you pretty much know what to expect ambiance-wise. A lot ofvelvet or leather, busy walls, a coffee table strewn with binders filled with past work, and the open space shared between the resident artists with buzzing coming from each corner of the room.
