Atelier Eva is a specialty tattoo studio and lifestyle experiencecreated by Turkish artist Eva Karabudak, a world-renowned artist who has tattooed the likes ofSam Smith, SZA, and Joe Jonas. Her style transcends traditional tattooing and is more evocative of fine art- her expertise is internationally acclaimed, pushing public opinion of the tattoo industry forward by presenting works that exemplifyrefined beauty, elegance, and sophistication— a theme that carries over into the decor of the shop. “Our primary objective was to create aserene environmentbecause receiving a tattoo can be a stressful experience,” Eva said in an interview withDezeen.

name: 40 Incredible Things To Do On The Upper East Side, Manhattan
description: The Upper East Side is an affluent neighborhood best known for its extravagance, but it’s also home to cozy restaurants, affordable thrift stores, and a Museum Mile beloved by all New Yorkers! Here’s our guide to making the most out of the Upper East side! Table Of Contents Green Kitchen is a casual spot providing a welcoming ambiance and solid breakfast. While their menu offers a wide variety of classic American breakfast foods, they’re most notable for theirfluffy buttermilk pancakes, the batter of which they’ve been making fresh every morning since 1931! Their brunch specials menu includes cider mimosas (amongst other cocktails), eggs Benedict, chicken & waffles, and more!

name: Be Your Own Professional Photographer At NYC’s First Self-Portrait Studio
description: NYC’s firstself portrait photo studiohas just arrived, and it’s completely changing the way we take selfies and professional photos. FotoLabmakes you your very own professional photographer. Using a clicker you’ll be able to snap photos that then get displayed on a digital screen, allowing you to take a look and make any adjustments you wish so you can be sure to snap the perfect shot! The concept, which is popular in Korea, was opened by couple Alan Li and Jamie Kim after realizing no such thing existed in NYC. Those interestedsimply just have to show up–FotoLab provides the rest.

name: 5 Black-Owned, Brooklyn Bred Brands You Absolutely Need In Your Closet
description: It’s no secret that New York is one of themost stylish cities in the world. From Harlem to the Upper East Side,SoHoto Flatbush, each corner of NYC has its own signature style that has been immortalized in pop culture. Whether you grew up watching Sex and The City, are a fan of Hip-Hop, consider yourself a hipster, or all of the above, it’s impossible to ignore the impact that the Big Apple has had on fashion for decades. Fashion is one of the things that make New York, New York. It’s not just about what you see people wearing, but how the outfit is styled and where the pieces come from.

name: Chill At This New York City Rooftop Bar That’s Made Entirely Of Ice
description: Head to the Polar Lounge on Harriet’s Rooftop at 1 Hotel Brooklyn Bridge for what may be thecoolestbar experience in NYC! Some of you may remember the Minus5 bar that used to be in the New York Hilton Midtown, but sadly the spot has been closed for a few years. Since then NYC has been missing its very own ice bar that has become a popular attraction in cities such as Vegas & beyond. But not any more! Last year, Harriet’s Rooftop debuted Polar Lounge—a bar made entirely of ice—and it was such a success that it’s made a comeback for 2023!

name: 13 Lovely Things To Do In Little Caribbean, Brooklyn
description: One of Brooklyn’s most vibrant neighborhoods is along the avenues of Flatbush, Church, and Nostrand, dubbed “Little Caribbean. ” It’s home to the largest Caribbean-American-LatinX community outside of the West Indies. The neighborhood got its official name back in 2017 thanks to Shelley Worrell, fromcaribBEING, a cultural organization amplifying the community and honoring the Caribbean Diaspora in NYC, leading the movement. From mouthwatering bakeries to unforgettable restaurants, there’s so many hidden gems throughout Brookyln’s Little Caribbean neighborhood to explore. And with the help of recommendations@littlecaribbeannyc, we’ve listed them below.

name: Sip Swiss Wine In A 1970s Gondola At This Charming Bar In The West Village
description: Be transported to the heart of Switzerland’s french-speaking region atThe Lavaux, a wine & fondue bar in the West Village. Sharing the fabulous traditions of Swiss culinary and wine with NYC, explore the fruits of Lavaux’s terroir and taste signature flavors of the sunny, mountainous region’s wine and cheese. Deemed a World Heritage site by UNESCO, Lavaux produces some of the world’s best wine, as the region consists of hundreds of hectares of vineyards. Unfamiliar with Swiss wines? Learn everything you need to know from the experienced staff as you taste direct imports from Swiss winemakers.

name: 28 Coolest Things To Do In Bushwick, Brooklyn
description: Table Of Contents Bushwick is one of Brooklyn’s rising neighborhoods in recent years, and it could be due to their swanky nightlife, good eats, and underground culture. To help you navigate the area a little easier, we narrowed it down to some of the best places to eat, drink, party, and have some fun! So hop on the L train and let’s get to it… This rather large and modern cafe is the perfect place to spend a day working remote, or even stopping by for a quick espresso shot! Plus, the staff is super friendly and the crowd that hangs out in here is very cool. Where:703 Hart St, Brooklyn Sey Coffee may have one the best interior of all the Bushwick cafes.

name: An Art Deco Café From Jaeger-LeCoultre Is Open In Manhattan For A Limited Time
description: Luxury watch company Jaeger-LeCoultre and French pastry chef Nina Metayer collaborated to inaugurate theReverso 1931 Cafélast year, and now it’s here in NYC for a limited time until Nov 22. So what do luxury watches and french pastries have in common? The café pays homage to theReverso watch. The piece was created in 1931 and is representative of iconic art deco design, a style popular in the 1930s for its polished geometric patterns. The café also pays tribute to the art deco style that remains throughout the landscape of New York City, such as the Chrysler building.

name: This Multi-Sensory Art Experience In NYC Will Take You On A Journey Of Self Discovery
description: INTER_ is an interactive art experiencethat tingles the senses and it’s opening on November 2nd at the INTER_IAM art center at 415 Broadway in Manhattan. This immersive journey offers a new way of engaging with elemental forces and delivers multi-sensory art that taps into the connection between the mind, body, and reality. This series of art installationshighlights the layers of the elements:fire, water, earth, air. It also explores a fifth element, ether, which represents one’s mind and awareness of it. Some of the multi-sensory art questions life’s purpose, one’s own journey, and one’s interconnection to the surrounding world.

name: NYC’s SUMMIT Is One Of The Most Instagrammable Places In The World
description: SUMMIT One Vanderbilttook the city by storm this past year allowing even the most jaded of New Yorkers to experience NYC like they never have before–from 1,100 feet up in the sky. In just one year they’ve become quite the NYC destination, holding titles like“Best Landmark in the United States”by Tiqests and one of themost Instagrammable placesin the world by ELLE Magazine. But they’re way more than just an observation deck! A multisensory, immersive experience, SUMMIT allows guests to step out onto fully transparent glass sky boxes, suspending them a heart-racing 1,100 feet above Madison Avenue. The external glass-bottomed elevator is the largest in the world and takes visitors an additional 120 feet up the side of the building.

name: 5 Best Places To Catch The Changing Fall Foliage In New York State
description: Theannual fall foliage reportfor the area is updated every week throughout the season indicating where and when to visit, so be sure to take advantage and schedule a weekend trip before winter officially begins. Whether you’re a native New Yorker or are just visiting, taking a drive outside of the five boroughs toenjoy apple pickingor to bask in the beauty of the autumn leaves is well worth it. And based on the fall foliage report, the autumn color foliage is beginning to change and peak in upstate NY! While some of these locations are way further than others (basically in Canada) we promise, the beauty is worthy of the drive. So although we can fight all day aboutwhere “upstate” really begins, at the end of the day what we really mean here is anything above Westchester County.

name: What’s Inside ‘The World’s Most Unusual Vending Machine’ Now In NYC
description: Atlas Obscura, online magazine and travel company, has teamed up with The Tennessee Department of Tourist Development, The Louisiana Office of Tourism, Visit North Carolina, and Visit Mississippi to bring flavors of the South to NYC in a convenient and unexpected way: via vending machine! The Southern Obscura Vending Machine will be located in Brooklyn’s McCarren Parkhouse fromOctober 6th – October 10th. This is the second iteration of ‘The World’s Most Unusual Vending Machine,’ following the 2021 installation that was created to coincide with the book launch ofGastro Obscura: A Food Adventurer’s Guide. This year’s machine will highlight Southern delicacies from bakers, farmers, and chefs in the American South. It will be unlike anything you’ve ever seen offered in typical vending machine!

name: A First Look Inside NYC’s Luxurious RH Guesthouse
description: RH Guesthouse opened its luxurious doors to New Yorkers on September 7, 2022. The opulent new stay is located at 55 Gansevoort Street in the Meatpacking District inside a restored loft building from the late 1880s, and just a stone’s throw away from RH New York, The Gallery at the Historic Meatpacking District. It’s striking triangular architecture and unique aesthetic boast floor-to-ceiling European oak and vein-cut Italian travertine with stainless steel accents. “Designed to erase the chaos of the outside world,” RH Guesthouse invites travelers to indulge in a ‘one-of-its-kind hospitality experience’ that prides itself on luxury and privacy. The building, that requires a private entrance, is home tosix guest rooms, three guest suitesand RH Chairman & CEO Gary Friedman’sprivate residencethat spans the entire top floor, which will be available for booking from time to time.

name: 9 Best Places For A Bike Rental In NYC
description: Let’s face it: no matter where you live in NYC, there’s bound to be traffic. From car traffic to foot traffic, there’s tons of action that can make it difficult to travel or have fun. Yet, despite the thousands of cars and millions of people passing through, there are still some time and money-saving options that make life easier, like biking! Whether you’re in need of a ride to work or are looking for some quality exercise, there are so many ways and reasons to bike around the city! If you’re in need of your own bike, look no further.

userId: Source / Courtesy Netflix / Stranger Things Experience
name: How To Get To NYC’s Must-Visit Stranger Things Experience In Brooklyn
description: Note: NYC’sStranger ThingsExperience has now officially ended. NYC’sStranger Things: The Experiencehas already been met with rave reviews by New Yorkers and visitors alike. With out-of-this-world visual effects, iconic sets and tons of nostalgic memorabilia, this is a trip back to the ‘80s you seriously don’t want to miss! But you better act fast because itcloses for goodSeptember 4th! Once you dopurchase your tickets, you’ll probably be wondering how to get there – and lucky for you we’ve mapped out all the modes of transportation.

name: The Gate To NYC’s Epic ‘Stranger Things’ Experience Is Closing Soon
description: Note: NYC’sStranger ThingsExperience has now officially ended. Listen up nerds,the gate to the Upside Down isonlyopen for a few more weeks in NYCand it’s up to you to help save Hawkins in this totally radStranger ThingsExperience before it’s too late! We got the chance to be some of the first guests to visit this one-of-a-kind experience when it opened. Friends don’t lie…it can’t be missed! Dare to explore the Upside Down yourself?

name: You Can Now Go Glamping In Renovated Shipping Containers On The East River
description: There’s a newglamping experiencein NYC! Sure it’s not on a beach or in the woods, but you do get to enjoy NYC’s bit of nature as it’s right on the East River waterfront. A new company called NYC Glamping has up-cycled rustic, industrial shipping containers info comfortable rooms with A/C, WiFi, a shower, and bathrooms in each. Located in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, the containers offer incredible views of the river and skyline (including the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building), and are the perfect spot to watch the dazzling NYC sunset. Plus, they are within walking distance to Transmitter Park, and lots of local restaurants and other Greenpoint attractions.

userId: Source / House of Spirits: A Haunted Cocktail Soirée
name: Get Tickets To The New Season Of NYC’s Haunted Cocktail Party, ‘House Of Spirits’ Before It Ends
description: Prepare yourself for a night full of mystery and magic, paired perfectly with cocktails but it’s only here until Oct. 31. This fall, you are invited to a Halloween soirée at a stylish, but eerie mansion. House of Spirits: Volkov Manoris a two-hour immersive cocktail experience with a disquieting and interactive storyline that promises to leave guests delightfully chilled! The evening takes placeat amysterious five-story mansionlocated at 60 Pine St.

name: This New Waterfront Al Fresco Lounge In Lower Manhattan Is Serving Vacay Vibes All Summer Long
description: The summer’s newest nautical oasis awaits at Brookfield Place and it’s called Portside. Portside is the “harborside hangout” we never knew we needed, until now! The seaside-inspired outpost will offer everything from sunset views to delicious bites, happy hours to weekly programming. The outpost is free to the public and open from9am to 9pm through September. Designed to be NYC’s very own coastal retreat, friends and family are welcome to come relax at the al fresco lounge that boasts killer views of the New York Harbor.

userId: Source / Photo by Adam Wilson on Unsplash
name: 11 Best Whiskey Bars In NYC You Need To Try
description: Whiskey is an international phenomenon, and it’s no shock that New York City boasts some of the most impressivewhiskey barsin the entire world. Whether it’s imported from Japan or distilled right here in the Big Apple, you can find some of the best bars serving the best drinks, right here in NYC. So here they are. ForOld Fashions,Irish whiskey cocktails, and so much more, head to these 11 whiskey bars in NYC. Flag-shipped in the Lower East Side for over 20 years, The Whiskey Ward is a local favorite that showcases over 500+ hand-selected whiskeys.

userId: Source / Flower Flashes by Lewis Miller Design / Photo Credit: Leatal Cohen, Pic and Petal for L.E.A.F
name: A Massive Floral Festival Is Returning To Meatpacking This Weekend
description: After last year’s massive floral festival displaying one million vibrant blooms, the L. E. A. F Flower Show will return to the Meatpacking District for a second year. The festival will run this weekend,Friday,June 10th and Saturday, June 11th from 11a.

name: Lincoln Center’s Bright Rainbow Steps Are Back For Pride Month
description: June isPride Month, a historic time to celebrate and advocate for the LGBTQ+ community. Two years ago, Lincoln Center lit up in Pride colors with incredible light displays for the first time in its history, and they’ve been continuing the tradition since. This year, the steps of the iconic Josie Robertson Plaza are once again rainbow, paving the way to NYC’s largest andbrand new outdoor dance floor! You’ll also see the symbolic Pride flag flying high in the sky. They will also have special LGBTQ+ programming June 21-24, including an “ULTRA PRIDE!

name: This Massive Italy Nightlife Staple Is Now NYC’s Largest Nightclub
description: NYC’s largest nightclub opened its doors a few weeks ago, and it’s bringing a little bit of Italy’s club life straight to NYC’s Hell’s Kitchen. Musica, which made its debut in Italy before making its way to the U. S. , is the joint venture of Giuseppe Cipriani and Italian entrepreneur Tito Pinton, who owns the il Muretto club near Venice, Italy. This 25,000-square-foot space, which used to be occupied by Prince Club, consists of three parts—a ground floor, main floor, and open-air rooftop with Hudson river views.

userId: Source / Photo courtesy of The Woo Woo
name: This New NYC Speakeasy Sex Shop Is Throwing It Back To The 80s • The Woo Woo
description: Bowling For Soup sang all about our relentless obsession with the year 1985, and this sultry new underground speakeasy is taking notes and serving up all the 1980’s vibes. Nestledunderneath the Mean Fiddler, this vintage stop calledThe Woo Woois taking us back a few decades to NYC’s grunge era. Ring the bell at the door inscribed with “Come As You Are” before entering into a time machine of graffiti walls, neon lights, and vintage punk concert posters. This all comes before arriving at the adults-only sex shop filled with authentic ’80s porn magazines, posters, and sex toys that are sure to bring a blush to your cheeks. The red curtain at the VCR bookcase portal leads you to the bar, where you’ll find 9 signature cocktails that throw a nod to throwback classics, such as thePrince-inspired Purple Rain, made with gin, lemongrass, celery, citrus, fresh mint, and pink peppercorn over purple rain ice,Frisky Business, their version of a piña colada served with rock candy and toasted marshmallow, andDirty Dancing, made with vanilla vodka, passionfruit, lime, and Prosecco with flambéed meringue.

name: Lincoln Center Opens ‘The Speakeasy,’ An Underground Pop-Up Performance Space & Bar
description: Those visiting Lincoln Center this summer will be able to journey underground at The Speakeasy for FREE performances varying from comedy to cabaret. It’s all taking place at Jaffe Drive beneath Lincoln Center’s campus. The Speakeasy, designed by Tony Award-winning costume and set designer Clint Ramos, has been in the making for quite some time now and New Yorkers can finally experience its magic from June 4th – August 13th. It boasts “a welcoming space for every audience to engage with Lincoln Center as their own: to dance in, to laugh, to meet up, and unwind. ” Be whisked away by the brilliance of Suzette Simon from NY Laughs or soothed with jazzy tunes from Wali Collins.

name: A Rift To Stranger Things’ Upside Down Will Open Across The ESB Tonight
description: Hey nerds, besides heading to Hawkins atNYC’s epic Stranger Things experiencefor a bitchin’ adventure, the city will honor the upcoming season in a thrilling new way tonight! On Friday, May 27, the saga’s fourth season will hit Netflix. In order to honor the mind-bending show,Netflix will open “rifts” to the Upside Down across landmarks worldwide on Thursday night, May 26, reportsIGN. Tons of cryptic messages across social media led up to Netflix’s exclusive announcement with IGN hinting to today’s visual spectacle. View this post on Instagram The rift will “gradually emerge on the southern facade of the Empire State Building”starting at 8:30 pm ET on Thursday, featuring iconic moments from prior seasons, and sneak peeks at season 4’s storylines.

name: This New NYC Rooftop Pool Club Has $60 Day Passes For Summer
description: There’s a new rooftop pool in town, and it may just be the perfect hangout spot for summer in the city! The Summer Club Rooftop Day Club & Pool just opened in Queens’ Long Island City, boasting elevated food and drinks, incredible skyline views and live sets from renowned DJs and musicians. The new city oasis was inspired by the kinds of day clubsin Miami and Las Vegas, with a lush floral archway entrance, palm trees and greenery, plus three full bars and 26 private cabanas along the terrace’s perimeter. At24,000 square feet, the day club and pool overlooks the skyline and also features an outdoor dining pavilion. “At The Summer Club, we want our guests to feel as though they’ve found a hidden gem in the heart of NYC,” owner Seth Levine stated in a press release.

userId: Source / Photo by Agathe Marty on Unsplash
name: Try NYC’s Best Espresso Martinis At This Themed Festival Coming In May
description: The first Espresso Martini Festival was started by premium coffee liqueur brand Mr Black back in Australia in 2016, followed by London, and now it’s coming to the states for the first time this month! Basically, for the full seven days between May 16-22, New Yorkers can get special$12 Espresso Martinis from NYC’s top cocktail bars and restaurants. Here are all the NYC bars & restaurants participating: The festival is also taking place in other U. S. cities including L.

userId: Source / The Seaport x Howard Hughes Corporation
name: Pier 17’s Mini Backyards Return To NYC With A New Dining & Drinking Experience This May
description: New Yorkers love their city through and through, but if you’ve been a tad bit jealous of the suburbs with their private backyards over the past couple years, we wouldn’t blame you. Luckily, you can once again get your own personal backyard experience in the city thanks to the returning rooftop pop-up called “The Greens”! They officially reopen for the seasonon Sunday, May 1. Located at Pier 17 in the Seaport, right alongside the water, The Greens will reinvent itself this season with three distinct spaces to compliment Pier 17’s Summer Concert Series:The Lawns, The Restaurant, and The Patrón Patio. The Lawns will once again feature the 32 10×10 square-foot mini backyards that can serve up to eight people.

userId: Source / Facebook/ Manhattan Vintage Clothing Show
name: Shop The World’s Largest Vintage Show Coming To NYC This Weekend
description: Manhattan Vintage is returning with their iconic triannual event, better known as the longest-running vintage show in NYC. Explore the “most prestigious of all vintage shopping events” on Friday, April 8th and Saturday, April 9th at Metropolitan Pavilion. Carefully curated by Amy Abrams and Ronen Glimer, the names behind Shop Extraordinary Enterprises, Manhattan Vintage’s parent company, Artist&Fleas, and Regeneration, the show will span across 25,000 sq ft. It will highlight more than 90 unique merchants, “making it the greatest collection of vintage clothing, accessories, and antique textiles that the world has to offer,” shared a recent press release. Items vary in price point, so everyone can celebrate over 100 years in fashion and design at every decade between the 20th and 21st century!

userId: Source / Gantry Plaza State Park, LIC. Instagram / @niredonahue
name: This Underrated LIC Park Has The Best Views Of The Manhattan Skyline
description: Nothingquitematches the feeling you get in your chest when you see the New York City skyline. And though you’ve surely viewed it from many different angles, whether an observation deck, rooftop or driving in from one of the bridges, you may not know that one of the best spots to take it in is in a Queens park (at least for views of the East Side! ) The 12-acreGantry Plaza State Park, located onthe waterfront of Long Island City, is a beautifully landscaped public space with breathtaking views of Manhattan. Bonus:see our full list of10 Best Waterfront Parks In NYC With Amazing Views. It’s also where the giant Pepsi-Cola sign is located, if you’ve seen it from the other side before!

name: There’s An Adorable Vintage Jet Plane Pop-Up In Grand Central Today
description: Pretend you’re back in the Golden Age of Travel at this pop-up installation in Grand Central Terminal! Put on by The Palm Beaches in Florida, a life-sized vintage jet plane has taken overVanderbilt HallfromWednesday, March 2 from 9 a. m. to 9 p. m.

userId: Source / Van Gogh: Immersive Night with Gustav Klimt
name: These Captivating Monet & Klimt Exhibitions Are Coming To NYC For A Limited Time
description: Earlier this year,Van Gogh: The Immersive Experiencemade its NY debutat Skylight on Vesey in FiDi. Now, bothGustav Klimt and Claude Monet will join Vincent Van Gogh, and their artworks will be metamorphized into an epic immersive experienceat the majestic NYC building right in the heart of Lower Manhattan. The two artists will take over the Van Gogh exhibition on separate nights, withVan Gogh: Immersive Night with Claude Monettaking placethis Friday, December 17,Thursday, December 23,andWednesday, December 29, whileVan Gogh: Immersive Night with Gustav Klimttaking place thisSaturday, December 18,Wednesday, December 22, andMonday, December 27. Expect digital displays, dreamy sound effects, projection mapping, and so much more! You’ll be able to takean awe-inspiring journey into the incomparable universe of Van Gogh, one of the greatest artistic geniuses of the 19th century.

name: You Can Stay In Carrie Bradshaw’s Fabulously Recreated UES Apartment This Month
description: Anyone who’s watched the iconic NY showSex & The Cityhas definitely thought that to themselves at one point or another. And now, well…you actually can! An apartmentexactlylike Carrie’s in fact. Although you can’t live in it full-time, you can pretend you’re SATC’s favorite writer forone night this November. To celebrate the upcomingnew reboot season“And Just Like That” & SATC’s 23rd anniversary, Airbnb is teaming up with Sarah Jessica Parker to offer New Yorkers (and visitors) a once-in-a-lifetime stay in the heart of Manhattan.

name: Take A Trip 1,200 Feet Above Manhattan In An All-Glass Elevator At NYC’s Newest Observatory Experience, SUMMIT
description: SUMMIT One Vanderbilt is the best new way to see the city. Opening to the public on October 21, SUMMIT takes visitors over 1,000 feet into the sky for an observatory experience that lets you explore the city like never before! Step out onto the fully transparent glass sky boxes called “Levitation” for a heart-racing perspective that places you 1,063 feet above Madison Avenue. Stand atop your favorite skyscrapers and take in the breathtaking sights all around you. Feeling even more adventurous?

userId: Source / All images courtesy of Henry Woide/Airbnb
name: You Can Stay At Winnie The Pooh’s House In England’s Hundred Acre Wood
description: Ever wanted to roam the Hundred Acre Wood with Pooh, Piglet, Christopher Robin, and the gang? A. A. Milne’s world-famous Winnie The Pooh has been capturing the hearts and imaginations of kids and adults alike since the 1920s, and it’s still going strong today. So, what if we told you that a visit to the Hundred Acre Wood was possible?

name: Take A Magical Journey Through Earth At This Multisensory, Eco-Friendly Installation In NYC
description: The visually stunningArcadia Earthcombines VR and AR technology with 360-degree art installations to reimagine the way we address the most pressing environmental issues of our time. With a focus on individual empowerment, each experience provides educational commentary uncovering truths about the environment – like the fact that we ingest the equivalent of one credit card a week in microplastics – followed by easily actionable suggestions to inspire everyone to have a positive impact on the future of our planet. 15 different rooms(spanning two floors) will take visitors through magical recreations of our planet’s landscapes and ecosystems, all shedding light on the ecological issues threatening our very existence — from overfishing to plastic pollution to food waste to climate change. But luckily, you’ll also learn the small lifestyle changes you can make that will have a massive impact on Earth’s future! Powered by augmented reality, virtual reality, projection mapping and interactive environments, you can exploretranscendent underwater worlds, primeval forests, mystical caves and fantasy lands… With both physical creations and high-tech VR headsets that will transport you to other lands… And everything is made with upcycled materials & items, designed by leading environmental artists!

name: A Floral Oasis Awaits At This NYC Pasta Bar Perfect For Summer Dining
description: The beloved Italian escape, Sola Pasta Bar, located in SoHo, has received a gorgeous summer makeover! And the space comes complete with a newly branded bar that opens up to downtown Manhattan. Bright yellow and white roses crown their sidewalk to create a beautiful ambiance alongside even more beautiful bowls of pasta. Guests can also choose to dine indoors at the Chef counter and watch their meals be made right before their eyes. Sola Pasta Bar features some incredibly creative dishes like their most notable24k Gold Spaghetti.

name: Netflix’s ‘Nailed It!’ At-Home Experience Is Back With A Summery, Marine-inspired Challenge!
description: Following the wildly successful launch ofNailed It! : Double Trouble! earlier this year, the popular at-home bake-off series is coming back with a new summery challenge. The new season, which is now streaming on Netflix, features double the contestants and double the mayhem, and once again you’re invited to partake in the pandemonium from home. Netflix has teamed up with Fever to bring the newNailed It!

name: This Bubble Tea Shop In Queens Is Entirely Pink And Includes An Arcade • Sweet Cats Cafe
description: Sweet Cats Cafeis the triple threat bubble tea shop you didn’t know you needed. A new location recently opened in Flushing, so get ready for cute photo-ops, tasty treats, and yes…arcade games! Upon entering the cafe you will be welcomed inside a world of pink walls, pink counters, and pink game machines. hidden pink arcade in nyc (queens) 🥺💕#nyc#newyorkcity#newyorkbucketlist#flushingny#nychiddengems ♬ Renai Circulation (English Cover) [2012 TV Size] – Lizz Robinett Test your skills at their many claw games and pay anywhere from $1-$3 (depending on what size claw machine you try) for your chance to win an adorable plushie! Grab one of their pink shopping carts to carry all your prizes as you move throughout the cafe.

name: Pop-Up ‘Dumpster Pools’ Could Be Coming To NYC Streets This Summer
description: NYC Comptroller Scott Stringer, who is also running for Mayor of New York City, just proposed a new plan for summer in the city which involves just that! [featured image: dumpster pool in NYC in 2010, creditMacro-sea] His “Summer in the City” proposal would ensure beaches and pools open on time — whichMayor de Blaso actually did confirm today— adding pop-up pools into the “Open Streets” program, +POOLs in the waterways, and much more: Our kids and families are so desperate for fun, and we absolutely have to give that to them this summer. With my Summer in the City plan, we’re going to give families all the resources they need for a great summer day right here in New York City. pic. twitter.

name: This Rooftop Comedy Night Showcases NYC’s Top Comics With A Stunning Backdrop
description: The Tiny Cupboard, a self-proclaimed hipster comedy club with its own church, is hosting incredible comedy performances on its giant rooftop in Bushwick! Every night Tuesday-Sunday, enjoy NYC’s comedians as they perform original material—talents who have been featured on the likes of Netflix, Late Night, MTV, Comedy Central, Conan, and more—while taking in the beautiful Manhattan skyline lit-up in the night. There are also plenty of COVID-19 safety measures in place, including socially distant seating and required face masks.

name: This Hidden Speakeasy Is Disguised Behind A NYC Bodega • The Little Shop
description: Next time your on a late night run for a deli sandwich and chips, maybe take a closer look around the bodega. At this little store on South Street Port, what may appear to be your regular New York City bodega actually has a secret cocktail bar and lounge in the back! View this post on Instagram Journey past the Ritz crackers and sugar on the shelf to find a hidden sliding door. Behind the door reveals a colorful lounge filled with vintage furniture and vibrant wallpaper! View this post on Instagram Drink cocktails from their collection of eclectic glasses like Purple Vesper (gin, vodka, lillet, lavender) or Tamarind (tequila, tamarind, lime, chili).

name: Uncover The Secrets Of NYC’s Iconic Grand Central Terminal On This Exciting Tour
description: Better understand the history of our magical city on this incrediblewalking tour of the mysteries hidden in NYC’s largest transportation hub. In the early 1900s, NYC Railroad noticed that the original Grand Central Depot was unfit for the progressive 20th century. As a result, they held a design competition to determine which company would be responsible for revamping the landmark we know it as today. Architecture firm Reed & Stem won the competition, but that wasn’t enough to satisfy the railroad and their hopes for the new terminal. To ensure that it was asgrandas they’d intended, an additional architect firm, Warren & Wetmore, was hired to collaborate with Reed & Stem as “Associated Architects.

name: Treat Yourself To One Of These Incredibly Relaxing And Peaceful NYC Spa Treatments
description: Stepping into a tranquil oasis, surrounded bycalming scents and soft music, the allure of spa treatments can transport your mind to a state of utter relaxation. With skilled masseurs catering to your every need, from soothing massages to invigorating facials, the spa is the ultimate escape from the stress and chaos of daily life. Lucky for us, NYC is not short ofspas to kick back, relax, and reset. Nothing sounds quite as good as sinking into a plush robe and indulging in a warm soak or steam toclear your mind and unwind. In a bustling city, the peaceful sanctuary of the spa brings a much-needed respite for the mind, body and soul.

name: City Winery’s Massive New Flagship Opens On The Pier 57 Waterfront This Thursday
description: City Winery is in the process of opening their massive new venue on Pier 57’s waterfront after Disney bought out their old SoHo space at 155 Varick Street. The new location for the winery is expected to be shared with Google, but will take up a whopping 32,000-square-feet that once housed the Marine and Aviation Pier. The new flagship space will open this week, on Thursday, Oct. 15 for both indoor and outdoor dining. Because it is such a huge space, that includes 200 seats indoors and 70 outdoors.

name: Andrew Lloyd Webber’s Legendary ‘Phantom Of The Opera’ Is Streaming For Free Right Now
description: Well we can help fill that theater void a little…Andrew Lloyd Webber’s iconic musical “The Phantom of the Opera” (which coincidentally ran on Broadway for 32 years) is streaming for free on YouTube for the next 48 hours! Starting at 2pm EST today, Oct. 9, that is. The YouTube channel thatappeared during the pandemicwhen we were all still quarantined at home, calledThe Show Must Go On, is coming back for anencore, if you will. The channel streamed a series of legendary Andrew Lloyd Webber musicals for no cost at all, fromJoseph And The Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat, toJesus Christ Superstar, toCats.

name: 85 Reasons Real New Yorkers Will Never Leave The City
description: How it’s “dead,”how New Yorkers are fleeing the city for greener pastures during the pandemic (okay, there are13,000 empty apartments in Manhattan, but it’s mostly high-end buildings! ), etc. But we know NYC can surviveanythinglife throws at her. After all, it’s called the “greatest city in the world” for a reason. And we know that there are so many New Yorkers who call this amazing city home, who are committed to her, through thick and thin, no matter what.

name: This Map Shows Over 6,000 NYC Restaurants Currently Open For Outdoor Dining
description: The NYC DOT (Department of Transportation) created a very detailed, interactive map,which can be seen here, that will help you figure out where to head out to dinner outdoors. First, it includes all NYC restaurants currently open for outdoor dining (the number is 6,955 right now! ). Then, it specifies which are serving alcohol, and which have sidewalk or roadway seating (or both). Restaurants can also apply to be added to the list.

name: Giant Face Masks Have Appeared On The Rockefeller Center Statues
description: Earlier this morning, many of the famous statues that sit in Rockefeller Center were all fitted with face masks (which must be quite large to cover the giant statues’ mouths! ). The clever surprise was part of an initiative from nonprofit Association for a Better NY and commercial real estate company Tishman Speyer, as a quirky way to helpwelcome New Yorkers intoPhase 2 of reopening. View this post on Instagram They cover: the golden Prometheus statue that sits above the iconic ice skating rink, the Mankind Figures (Maiden and Youth), sitting on either side of Prometheus, and the Atlas statue, which sits in the International Building’s courtyard across Fifth Avenue from St. Patrick’s Cathedral.

name: Experience Breathtaking Music By Candlelight In These Beautiful NYC Spaces
description: Fever’s widely popularCandlelight seriesis bringing mesmerizing classical, jazz, and pop numbers by candlelight toNYC’s loveliest spaces. These renowned events are coming to inviting spaces and transforming them into uniquemusic venues in New York—which range from historic Manhattan cathedrals to luxe modern hotels. You can enjoy tributes toBeyoncéandTaylor Swiftor take in the melodic notes ofanime theme songs, all while an elegant space is bathed in thousands of flickering candles. FromThe Sheen CentertoThe Opera House, NY venues become almost unrecognizable in the glow of warm candlelight. Table Of Contents Situated on historic Bleecker Street, The Sheen Center for Thought and Culture has hosted countless cultural events, including movie premieres, and concerts.

name: Rising Artists Are Taking Over Our ‘Lockdown Live’ Series This Month
description: You don’t have to travel far (or at all) to be able to create inspiring artwork, and enjoy the work of others. As part of our new‘Lockdown Live’ series, curated in partnership with Martell, we’re highlighting some of the country’s most talented artists—from illustrators to musicians. Joining us next on Tuesday, May 19, isillustrator Markus Prime, who’s made waves in the industry and even sparked some controversy over his no-nonsense creations that astutely address social issues. Known on Instagram for his sex positive comic stripOh Nah. , Prime was originally recognized for reimagined characters like Mario from Super Mario Bros.

name: You Can Now Stream The Globe Theatre’s Shakespeare Plays For Free
description: The Globe Theater may be shut down in London, but there are still ways to get your fill of Shakespeare during our current period of quarantine. The famed wooden O has been recording their productions for years, and as right now, you’re able to stream some of these iconic performances, for free, on theirGlobe Player. (Featured image:@the_globe) The free shows kicked off with an incredible production of the tragic playHamlet, starring none other than Globe Artistic Director Michelle Terry in the title role. Now,Romeo and Juliethas become the next production to head online, streaming free until May 3. It’s the 2009 Globe production, in which Dominic Dromgoole directed Ellie Kendrick as Juliet and Adetomiwa Edun as Romeo, to plenty of warm reviews.

name: NYC Will Join Over 150 Landmarks Around The Country To Light Up Blue Tonight For Healthcare Workers
description: #LightItBluestarted in the U. K. to help show support for their National Health Service workers, and now we’re practicing it in NYC. According to a press release, these landmarksinclude: Madison Square Garden, the billboards in Times Square, One World Trade Center, The Intrepid Museum, the Vessel at Hudson Yards, 7 World Trade Center, Andaz 5th Avenue, Beacon Theater, Citi Field, Con Edison Headquarters Clock Tower, East River Plaza, Grand Hyatt, Hard Rock Cafe, Macy’s Herald Square, New Victory Theatre, Parker New York, Pier 17, Rockefeller Center, The Dominick Hotel, The Helmsley Building, The Redbury New York, and The Shops at Columbus Circle. The #LightItBlue event was organized by Thinkwell Group, a design and production agency, and #MakeItBlue.

name: The Empire State Building Will Shine Red For ‘Heartbeat Of America’ Every Night Through COVID-19 Battle
description: The building managers just shared that they have a new plan for lighting up the tower every evening, one that pays respects to the entire country as well as all of the medical workers fighting coronavirus every single day. “We’ll never stop shining for you,” they wroteon social media. “Starting tonight [March 30] through the COVID-19 battle, our signature white lights will be replaced by theheartbeat of Americawith awhite and red siren in the mastfor heroic emergency workers on the front line of the fight. ” This is in addition to the brand music-to-light show that takes place every night at 9pm, synched to “Empire State of Mind. ” They synch it withZ100 and iHeartRadio.
